column2: Skills           communication skill             Microsoft Office             Team Leadership                     Safety Planning: Develop and implement safety plans and procedures for the site based on regulatory requirements and industry best practices. This includes conducting risk assessments and identifying potential hazards specific to the site.     Safety Inspections: Regularly inspect the site to identify any safety hazards, unsafe practices, or equipment deficiencies. This involves inspecting scaffolding, machinery, electrical systems, and other site-specific elements to ensure compliance with safety standards.     Hazard Identification and Mitigation: Identify potential safety hazards and risks associated with the sites activities, processes, or equipment. Develop strategies to mitigate these hazards and implement control measures to minimize risks to workers and the environment.     Safety Training: Provide safety training to workers on the site. This includes conducting orientation sessions for new employees, delivering toolbox talks, and organizing specialized training programs for specific tasks or equipment usage. Promote a safety culture and ensure that workers are aware of and comply with safety regulations.     Incident Investigation: Investigate accidents, incidents, near misses, or safety breaches that occur on the site. Identify the root causes and contributing factors of these incidents and make recommendations to prevent similar occurrences in the future. Maintain incident records and report findings to management.     Safety Compliance: Ensure compliance with local, state, and federal safety regulations, as well as any applicable industry-specific standards. Stay updated on changes in safety regulations and ensure that the site remains in compliance.     Emergency Preparedness: Develop emergency response plans for the site and conduct drills or simulations to test the effectiveness of the plans. Coordinate with emergency services and ensure that appropriate first aid facilities and equipment are available on-site.     Communication and Collaboration: Collaborate with site managers, supervisors, and workers to promote a culture of safety and ensure that safety measures are integrated into daily operations. Communicate safety guidelines, provide training and guidance, and address safety concerns raised by workers.     Documentation and Reporting: Maintain accurate records of safety inspections, training sessions, incidents, and safety-related communications. Prepare reports on safety performance, trends, and areas for improvement. Provide regular updates to management on the sites safety status.                 Qualification : BE Civil / Diploma Civil

column2: Strong working knowledge of many design techniques and analysis methods, and detailed knowledge of the content and application of standards, codes and guidelines as applicable for offshore.         Essential Qualifications and Education:         Bachelor Degree in Civil or Structural Engineering     6+ yrs in oil and gas with major contractor or consultant predominantly performing detail design of offshore facilities         Preferred Qualifications and Education:         Master Degree is Preferred     Preferably Registered Professional Engineer or member of professional engineering society         Key Tasks and Responsibilities:         Perform conceptual, FEED, Studies, and detailed analyses and design as per design basis, project specifications, design codes and standards.     Apply knowledge and skills to a wide range of standard and nonstandard situations.     Prepare clear and accurate detailed design calculations and analyses including design reports and procedures.     Manage own time to meet agreed deadlines and budgets, and develop plans for short-term work activities in own area.     Clearly communicate and explain complex issues and work to establish understanding.     Be fully familiar with the project scope of work, specifications, schedule and all inter-discipline requirements; including identifying concerns as early as practicable and taking appropriate initiatives to address the issues.     Identify changes to scope and promptly raise change notifications, including providing any necessary supporting documentation and estimates. Provide similar support for Variation Orders.     Interface with all disciplines to develop clash free designs.     Interface with other departments to obtain input for Discipline designs and drawings.     Maintain close co-ordination with other engineering disciplines, Planning, Fabrication, Marine, and Project Management Team, as required.     Document substantive communications (communications that result in significant decisions or assignment of actions) and forward copies to Discipline Lead Engineer and Discipline Manager. Assist in preparation of estimates for bid proposals, including technical query reviews, execution statements and manhour estimates.     Raise technical queries to obtain missing information, clarify work scope, and to maintain preferred McDermott procedures, specifications, standards, practices and operational requirements.     Prepare Discipline engineering design basis, philosophies, and technical specifications, as required. Participate in finalizing deliverables lists and deliverables, ensuring compliance with specifications and functional integrity.     Attend project review meetings, vendor meetings, engineering meetings and offshore site surveys, as required.     Provide technical direction and review of Designers producing products related to Construction Support Engineering.     Prepare and review design reports and procedures.     Assist in providing necessary design inputs to other disciplines to enable them in proceeding with their deliverables.     Assist procurement personnel in procuring Discipline equipment, materials and services; ensuring that work produced complies with Customer objectives and procedures. Procurement assistance includes preparing and reviewing requisitions, evaluating technical quotations and preparing queries, compiling bid tabulations and recommendations, preparing purchase requisitions, and coordinating with Procurement to expedite vendor documents, as directed by Discipline Lead Engineer.     Assist in updating weight report based on receipt of vendor information.     Check engineering performed by others within Discipline.     Review vendor and subcontractor submittals, checking for compliance with project specifications and providing comments as necessary.     Perform design verification through single-discipline check / inter-discipline check (IDC).     Provide technical support to all fabrication queries, including identifying defect / rectification requirements.     Keep the Lead Engineer apprised of all activities and concerns, technical, budgetary and manpower related.     Assist in providing inputs for actual, planning and forecasting progress reports including associated productivity.     Check final subcontractor and vendor data manuals to ensure that all requested data has been received and approved.     Participate in internal, Customer and third party technical audits on engineering deliverables and vendor documents.     Assist Lead Engineer with responses to Customer and other agencies (such as certifying authorities, auditors, third parties, etc) on their review and approval.     Capture lessons learned and enter into MDRs Lessons Learned system.     Capture Knowledge Objects and enter into MDRs K.now system.     Act as a resource for colleagues with less experience.     Guide less experienced engineers on MDR and Discipline procedures, standards, worksheets, design calculations, software, requisitions, technical bid evaluations, technical queries, etc     Be aware of costs related to own work and of the discipline.       Perform / review designs, analyses, evaluations, calculations and procedures such as:       Erection sequences for jackets, topsides, and other structures     Loadout procedures and guidance during the operations     Construction lift analyses and procedures for activities such as floatovers, stackings, roll- ups, etc     Weighing procedures     Design and detailing of miscellaneous fabrication yard items     Crane arrangements and rigging arrangements     Trailer arrangements/operations, including drawings and procedures         Assist Lead Engineer in coordinating critical operations pre-activity meetings.

column2: Roles and Responsibilities  We are seeking a skilled Piping Engineer with 2-7 years of experience in the oil and gas industry to join our dynamic team. As a Piping Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, analyzing, and overseeing the installation of piping systems in oil and gas facilities. Key Responsibilities: Design and Analysis:  Develop detailed piping layouts, specifications, and material selections based on project requirements and industry standards. Perform stress analysis and ensure compliance with codes and regulations. Project Coordination:  Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams including process engineers, mechanical engineers, and designers to integrate piping systems into overall facility designs. Coordinate with vendors and contractors for procurement and installation activities. Risk Assessment:  Identify potential risks and hazards related to piping systems and develop mitigation strategies to ensure safety and environmental compliance. Quality Assurance:  Conduct inspections and quality checks throughout the project lifecycle to ensure adherence to design specifications, standards, and project schedules. Documentation:  Prepare technical documentation including piping drawings, specifications, material lists, and as-built records. Maintain accurate records of project activities and communicate progress to stakeholders. Problem Solving:  Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues related to piping design, installation, and operation. Provide innovative solutions to optimize piping system performance and efficiency. Continuous Improvement:  Stay updated with industry trends, technologies, and best practices related to piping engineering. Identify opportunities for process improvement and contribute to the development of engineering standards and guidelines. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering or related field. 2-7 years of experience in piping engineering, preferably in the oil and gas industry. Proficiency in piping design software such as AutoCAD, PDMS, or similar tools. Strong understanding of piping codes and standards (e.g., ASME, API, ANSI). Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment. Job Benefits & Perks
column11: Piping Engineering, Project Management, Piping Layout

Key responsibility areas:         Planning and preparing technical drawings and construction layouts     Reviewing work schedules and delegating work tasks     Organising construction materials and negotiating vendor contracts     Conducting preliminary inspections at potential construction sites     Gathering data and writing site reports and other necessary work documentation Determining project feasibility and giving approval     Developing construction project budget estimates     Providing technical advice and diagnosing and resolving technical difficulties     Ensuring compliance with health, safety and legal regulations     Collaborating with clients, construction crews, subcontractors and other professionals Conducting quality assurance and providing feedback     Site Engineer Requirements:           Bachelors degree in engineering, construction, or similar       Experience in a similar role     Additional certificates or licenses may be required     Sound knowledge of Engineering, construction, and design     Great leadership and organizational skills     Project management skills     Ability to apply logical and critical thinking skills to projects     Great written and verbal communication skills     A willingness to learn

column2: Bachelor degree or equivalent in Electrical Engineering.          Diploma candidates preferably with good experience will be considered.            Key Skills:         Uses CAD system to enter the required data, such as precise measurements and commands, in order to generate construction drawings, renderings, report graphics and other digital images.         Prepares complex layouts, drawings and designs from written or verbal specifications or from rough or detailed sketches and/or drawings made by technicians, designers or technical professionals, converting paper documents into computerized file.          Produces various design options on the screen or in hard copy, following a designer or technical professional verbal instructions or ideas to assist in resolving a design concept not yet completely defined.          Ability to diagnose and correct equipment problems and assist in training lower level technicians and/or other personnel wishing to learn to operate CAD equipment. Check documentation complies with Design Criteria/Client Brief/Approved Concept / Standards.      Attend design, clients, architects and site meetings.      Resolve any technical problems faced during the project design and/or construction stages.      Senior engineers must be able to lead projects and supervise a team of engineers/technicians under their charge. Desired Profile:         The desired candidate must have extensive design knowledge and experience for building projects in an engineering consultancy firm.         An ideal candidate should possess the following qualifications:          Recognised Bachelor degree or equivalent in Electrical Engineering; Diploma candidates preferably with good experience will be considered.      At least 5 years and above of design experience      Design experience must in electrical services in residential, commercial or mixed development projects.      Working Knowledge of softwares such as MS Office, AutoCAD, and Dialux & Revit MEP is a must.      Experience with leading project management/ Team Leaders would be an advantage.

Strategic Planning and Project Management: Develop a comprehensive strategy for hospital construction projects, aligning with the organization's healthcare delivery goals. Define project scopes, objectives, and deliverables in consideration of budget, resources, and clinical requirements. Plan and execute hospital construction projects from initiation to completion, ensuring adherence to project timelines and budgets. 2. Team Leadership and Collaboration: Lead and manage a multidisciplinary team, including architects, In-house MEP engineers, contractors, external consultants, healthcare professionals, and support staff for planning, design, project management and construction of hospitals. 3. Project Design & Quality Assurance: Collaborate with healthcare regulatory authorities to obtain necessary approvals and permits for construction projects. Implement quality control measures to maintain high standards in facility design, construction, and infrastructure. Evaluate the design and construction feasibility of the projects. Detail Design of Project: Estimate the detailed designs of the entire project with the help of in-house engineering team and external consultants. 4. Financial Management: Develop and manage budgets for hospital construction projects, monitoring expenditures and cost control measures. Risk Management and Problem Solving: Identify potential risks and challenges in hospital construction projects and develop strategies to mitigate them. Implement contingency plans to address unforeseen issues and minimize project disruptions. Project Documentation and Reporting: Maintain accurate and organized project documentation, including plans, contracts, progress reports, and regulatory approvals. Generate regular reports for senior management and stakeholders, highlighting project performance, milestones, and deviations. column2: We are currently seeking a reliable Construction Manager to join our team in South America. In this role, you will be responsible for planning the construction for projects and overseeing their progress from start to finish in a timely and cost-effective manner. Your key responsibilities will include  Project Construction Planning, Control and Scheduling Management, Budget Management, Supervision and Coordination, Risk Management, Quality Control, Documentation and Reporting, Problem solving ability. With your keen attention to detail and strong organizational skills, you will ensure that all construction activities align with the established scope, timeline and budget. Role & responsibilities     Site Inspection : Conduct regular site visits to inspect progress, ensure compliance with safety regulations, and address any issues that arise. Coordination Meeting s: Hold meetings with subcontractors, engineers, architects, and other stakeholders to discuss project status, resolve issues, and plan upcoming tasks. Schedule Management : Monitor project schedules and adjust timelines as needed to ensure timely completion of tasks and adherence to project milestones. Material Procurement : Coordinate with suppliers/contractors to procure materials and equipment required for ongoing construction activities, ensuring timely delivery and quality standards. Quality Control : Conduct inspections to ensure that construction work meets quality standards and specifications. Address any deficiencies or deviations from the approved plans. Safety Management : Implement and enforce safety protocols to minimize the risk of accidents and injuries on the construction site. Conduct safety meetings and inspections to promote a safe working environment. Budget Tracking : Monitor project expenditures and track costs against the budget. Identify areas where costs can be optimized and implement cost-saving measures where possible. Contractor Bill Processing : To verify and process the contractor bills monthly.  Documentation : Maintain accurate records of project activities, including contracts, permits, change orders, daily logs, and progress reports. Ensure that all documentation is organized and up to date. Subcontractor Management : Coordinate with subcontractors to ensure that work is completed according to schedule and quality standards. Address any issues or disputes that arise with subcontractors. Client Communication : Communicate regularly with clients to provide updates on project progress, address any concerns or questions they may have, and ensure that their expectations are being met. Problem Solving : Identify and resolve issues that arise during construction, such as logistical challenges, design conflicts, or unexpected site conditions. Implement effective solutions to keep the project on track. Change Management : Manage change orders and revisions to the project scope, ensuring that any changes are properly documented, approved, and implemented in a timely manner. Team Leadership : Provide leadership and guidance to project team members, including subcontractors, foremen, and laborers. Delegate tasks and responsibilities effectively to ensure efficient project execution. Progress Reporting : Prepare and distribute regular progress reports to stakeholders, including clients, project owners, and senior management. Highlight key milestones, achievements, and upcoming activities. Continuous Improvement : Identify opportunities for process improvement and implement best practices to enhance project efficiency, productivity, and quality. Preferred candidate profile     Proven work experience in construction management Advanced knowledge of construction management processes, means and methods Expert knowledge of building products, construction details and relevant rules, regulations and quality standards Understanding of all facets of the construction process Familiarity with construction management software Competent in conflict and crisis management Excellent time and project management skills Degree in construction management, engineering or related field Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Good written, oral English, and presentation skills. Perks and benefits     Accommodation Health Insurance

column2: Job   Description: Senior   Quality   Manager   :   Irrigation   Project Profile Summary: The Senior Quality Manager in a construction company holds a pivotal role in overseeing and ensuring the adherence to high-quality standards throughout all stages of construction projects. Their primary responsibilities include developing and implementing quality assurance strategies, planning and executing quality control measures, managing supplier quality, training staff on quality protocols, addressing non-conformity, and ensuring compliance with regulations and client requirements. By effectively fulfilling these duties, the Senior Quality Manager plays a vital role in upholding the reputation of the company, enhancing customer satisfaction, and driving continuous improvement in construction processes and outcomes. Responsibilities: 1. Develop and implement comprehensive quality management systems and procedures tailored to the unique requirements of the irrigation project, ensuring alignment with industry standards, specifications, and regulatory requirements. 2. Lead and mentor a team of quality professionals, providing guidance, training, and support to ensure the effective execution of quality assurance and quality control activities throughout the project life cycle. 3. Collaborate with project managers, engineers, subcontractors, and suppliers to establish quality requirements, specifications, and acceptance criteria for materials, components, and construction activities related to the irrigation system. 4. Conduct regular quality inspections, audits, and reviews of project activities, ensuring compliance with established quality standards, specifications, and contractual requirements. 5. Implement robust quality control measures to monitor and verify the quality of workmanship, materials, and equipment used in the construction of the irrigation system, identifying and addressing any non-conformities or deviations promptly. 6. Develop and maintain quality documentation, including quality plans, inspection reports, test records, and non-conformance reports, ensuring accuracy, completeness, and traceability of quality-related information. 7. Lead root cause analysis investigations and corrective action processes to address quality issues, defects, or deficiencies, implementing preventive measures to prevent recurrence and minimize project risk. 8. Coordinate with external quality assurance and certification bodies as required to obtain necessary approvals, certifications, and compliance documentation for the irrigation project. 9. Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and quality metrics to track project quality performance, analyze trends, and identify opportunities for improvement, reporting findings to project stakeholders and management.  10. Drive continuous improvement initiatives to enhance project quality, efficiency, and effectiveness, leveraging lessons learned, best practices, and innovative technologies to optimize project outcomes. Requirements: 1. Bachelor's degree BE in civil engineering ,Construction Management. 2. Proficiency in project management software (e.g., Primavera P6, Microsoft Project) and Microsoft Office Suite. 3. Strong analytical skills and attention to detail, with the ability to interpret technical data and make informed decisions. 4. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively engage with diverse stakeholders. 5. Knowledge of irrigation systems, hydraulics, and water management principles. 6. Familiarity with relevant regulations, standards, and best practices in the irrigation industry. 7. Leadership qualities with a proven track record of successfully leading teams and delivering projects on time and within budget. Project   details: 1. Company Headquarter: Nagpur 2. Company: Infratech Construction Company 3. Project Name: Jigaon Project 4. Site location: Tal. Nandura, Dist.Buldana. Construction of Earthen Dam including spillway stilling basin, divide wall approach road, tail channel of Jigaon Project.

column1: Vice President/ Senior Project Manager - Civil
column2: As a Vice President/Senior Project Manager in Civil Engineering, you would typically be responsible for overseeing a variety of construction projects, ensuring they're completed safely, on time, and within budget. Here's a breakdown of some key responsibilities and skills: Project Management : You'll be responsible for planning, executing, and closing projects. This involves creating project plans, setting timelines, allocating resources, and managing budgets. Team Leadership : You'll lead a team of engineers, architects, and other professionals involved in the project. This requires excellent leadership and communication skills to ensure everyone is aligned and working towards the project goals. Client Relations : Building and maintaining strong relationships with clients is crucial. You'll be the main point of contact for clients, addressing their concerns, providing updates, and ensuring their needs are met throughout the project. Technical Expertise : A deep understanding of civil engineering principles and practices is essential. You'll need to review technical drawings, resolve design issues, and ensure that all work meets industry standards and regulations. Risk Management : Identifying and mitigating risks is a key aspect of project management. You'll need to anticipate potential issues, develop contingency plans, and take proactive steps to minimize disruptions to the project. Contract Negotiation : You may be involved in negotiating contracts with clients, subcontractors, and vendors. This requires strong negotiation skills and a thorough understanding of legal and financial terms. Quality Control : Ensuring quality throughout the project is essential. You'll be responsible for conducting regular inspections, reviewing workmanship, and implementing quality control measures to maintain high standards. Financial Management : Managing project budgets and finances is a critical aspect of the role. You'll need to track expenses, monitor cash flow, and make strategic decisions to keep the project financially viable.
column11: High Rise Building, Residential, Team Management, Real Estate Construction, Construction, Construction Management, Project Management, Civil Project Management, Civil Site Engineering, Site Execution, Civil Engineering

column2: As an MEP Design Engineer at Envigaurd, you will be responsible for designing and coordinating Mechanical, Electrical, and Plumbing (MEP) systems for various construction projects      With your expertise and experience, you will contribute to the successful implementation of MEP designs, ensuring functionality, efficiency, and compliance with relevant codes and standards      You will collaborate closely with architects, contractors, and other project stakeholders to deliver high-quality MEP solutions          Responsibilities:                  Design Development:          Develop comprehensive MEP design concepts, including HVAC, electrical, plumbing, and fire protection systems, considering project requirements and client specifications. Coordination and Collaboration:          Collaborate with architects, structural engineers, and other design professionals to ensure seamless integration of MEP systems with the overall building design.      Coordinate with contractors, vendors, and suppliers to obtain necessary information and materials for MEP installations.      Participate in interdisciplinary meetings and provide technical guidance and expertise to resolve design conflicts or issues.          Compliance and Quality Assurance:          Ensure MEP designs comply with relevant building codes, regulations, and industry standards.      Conduct thorough quality checks and reviews of design documents to maintain accuracy and completeness.      Perform site visits and inspections to verify the implementation of MEP designs and address any on-site challenges or modifications.          Project Management    :        Assist in the preparation of project schedules, budgets, and cost estimates for MEP design and installation.      Monitor project progress and provide regular updates to project managers and stakeholders.      Collaborate with the project team to identify and implement design improvements and value engineering solutions.          People Management and Mentorship:          Provide guidance, mentorship, and technical support to junior engineers and drafters.      Foster a collaborative and supportive work environment, promoting knowledge sharing and continuous learning.      Effectively communicate and coordinate with team members, ensuring efficient workflow and successful project delivery.          Technical Expertise:          Stay updated with the latest advancements, technologies, and trends in MEP systems design and implementation.      Provide technical support and mentorship to junior engineers and drafters as required.          Requirements:          Bachelor/Masters degree in Mechanical/Electrical/Civil Engineering or a related field.      4-5 years of experience in MEP design and coordination for building construction projects.      Strong knowledge of MEP systems, including HVAC, electrical, plumbing, and fire protection.      Proficiency in design software such as AutoCAD, Revit, or similar tools.      Familiarity with relevant building codes, regulations, and industry standards.      Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.      Effective communication and collaboration abilities.      Project management skills and the ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously.      Join our team of talented professionals and contribute to the successful delivery of MEP design solutions.

column2: The      Piping Field Engineer is responsible for activities relating to construction engineering within the Piping/Mechanical discipline.          This position will be responsible for a variety of construction tasks utilizing      codes and standards related to pipe, equipment and machinery installations.          Responsibilities include the development of work plans, interpreting vendor installation drawings and manuals, coordinating materials, performing and documenting inspections, reporting progress, and resolving conflicts in design and construction related to the installation and testing of mechanical equipment and piping commodities.          This position requires good planning and organizational skills, ability to perform detailed inspections and the ability to produce documentation.      Duties and Responsibilities:                        Coordinate with engineering on constructability and design issues relating to mechanical equipment and related systems.            Develop work plans, coordinate materials, perform and document inspections, report progress, and resolve conflicts in design and construction related to the installation and testing of piping/mechanical equipment and commodities.            Provide leadership in a team-based environment.            Responsible for the activities of assigned construction engineers.            Direct the preparation of material take offs for field purchased piping material and equipment.            Review requisitions for field purchases.            Support field procurement in inspection and receipt of piping and pipe support materials.            Review the preparation of construction drawings and schedules.            Assist Field Engineers and Superintendents in the interpretation of design and vendor drawings, monitor pipe commodity delivery, storage, and installation.            Interface with survey team for laser scanning, as-building and general layout for equipment and piping installations.            Review specifications, procedures, inspection reports, delivery schedules, vendor manuals and technical data.            Responsible for development of pressure test packages, performance, witnessing and documentation of test acceptance.            Coordinate with Subcontractor work efforts and interfaces with client personnel as required.            Interface with the Construction Automation Group and Project Controls. Perform take offs from Issued For Construction drawings, provide input to the quantity tracking applications and reports weekly installed quantities to Project Controls.            Perform constructability reviews of engineering design, resolves issues with engineering and fabricator.            Work within TEAM. Works to verify accurate data from engineering and suppliers.            Take an active lead in promoting a safe work environment and be committed to ATMAN s Zero Accident Program.            Participate in and foster a work environment that is based upon openness, trust, communication, teamwork empowerment, innovation, and satisfaction.                                      Skills Required:                      Ideal candidate will have a minimum of 7 years of working experience in EPC project execution. Experience in Food Beverage industry will be preferred.                        Qualifications and Skills                                            Basic Qualifications:                Bachelor s degree in Engineering, Construction, or a related subject from an accredited university and 1 year of Field Engineering or related experience or, in lieu of a degree, 7+ years of directly related experience.            Be physically able to conduct field inspections and participate in project walk-downs which may require the following activities: extensive walking in and around a construction site, climbing ladders, climbing scaffolding, using fall protection and other personal protective equipment (PPE), walking on elevated platforms, walking on uneven surfaces, and maneuvering around very small and/or confined spaces.                          Minimum Qualifications:                Working in a field construction environment interpreting specification, procedures, vendor drawings and installation instructions, and codes.            Understanding piping PID s, isometrics drawings, pipe support drawings            Scoping, preparation, execution, and restoration of mechanical systems and equipment (motors, cranes, hoists, rails).            Working closely with diverse construction disciplines, craftsmen, and oversight organizations.            Experience with piping and pipe support installation and inspection and pressure testing of piping.            Experience with installation of mechanical equipment, piping and pipe supports.            Strong knowledge of ASME and related ASTM material standards and codes.            Strong ability to read, understand and interpret mechanical/piping installation/construction drawings.            Strong understanding of change management and configuration control processes.            Understanding of welding processes.            Technical knowledge of a specialized engineering discipline, cost, scheduling, and contracts administration relating to the construction of heavy industrial or commercial complexes.            Strong understanding construction/system completion walk-downs, pressure testing.            General awareness of environmental laws. Awareness of government compliance standards.            Knowledge of requirements for Lock Out Tag Out for safety.            Computer literate in word processing, spreadsheet, and database applications.            Experience working with, supervising, and administering subcontractors.                              Preferred Qualifications:                Possess      Construction knowledge preferred.            Knowledge of      Zero Accident Safety Program and familiar with current industry standards.            Familiarity with current industry quality standards.            Knowledge of project specific environmental compliance requirements.            Knowledge and experience of the piping guiding principles and core functions.

column2: CAI is seeking motivated Building Commissioning/Data Centre Electrical Lead professionals to support Data Centre projects across the APAC Region. These are full-time opportunities with competitive compensation and benefits which include: up to 15% retirement contribution, medical insurance for employee and eligible dependents, dental insurance, life and disability insurance, maternity coverage for employee or spouse and financial support for both internal and external professional education. CAI is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.         As consultants to the entire industry, our employee owners are driven by the challenge and constant diversity of assignments, while having the stability of a company that has never had a lay off. On any given day we could be responsible for a myriad of things involved in starting a facility, equipment startup and test script writing and execution, SATs, walk downs, FWT / FATs, burn in tests and development of summary reports at the client site.          Lead Electrical Engineers will work as part of the CAI Data Centre / Building Commissioning team and be responsible for the commissioning of mission critical electrical equipment, safe electrical work practices, facility turnover, and issue resolution. Data Centre/ Building Commissioning professionals develop and execute the commissioning tests to demonstrate to the customer that vendor equipment is correctly installed and set to work, support enhanced design reviews, and consult on submission of LEED qualification packages.             Responsibilities:                               Development of electrical equipment and system test scripts         Attend and be an active participant of customer equipment FWT/FAT         Vendor coordination and management         Perform equipment inspection to ensure build adherence to vendor submittal         Provide test and documentation that equipment is delivered, installed, and tested correctly and set to function properly for customer         Support and perform design specification review, manufacturer submittals, one line drawing sets, and project schedule documentation         QA/QC of electrical equipment installation\startup         Assign test commissioning tasks to electrical commissioning team         Execute test scripts to confirm equipment and system operation to design specification         Ensure safe work practices are followed by all on commissioning team and customer site         Engage with customers to ensure positive experience, goals achievement, and schedule adherence         Provide daily reports for electrical commissioning team status         Conduct facility walk downs, turnover, and punch list reviews         General understanding of LEED specifications and requirements         Look for new opportunities for CAI to provide service and value to customer         Business development in a part time capacity.         Duties may be increased as experience and skill allow                     Qualifications     :                   Bachelor s degree in electrical or equivalent           Minimum of 12 years Building or Data Center Commissioning experience       .         Knowledge of OSHA and NFPA 70E safety requirements.         Good written and spoken communication skills.         Ability to read and interpret electrical schematics and specifications.         Knowledge of Data Center design concepts.         Knowledge and commissioning experience with Electrical Distribution Switchgear, Substations, Uninterruptable Power Sources (UPS), Automatic Transfer Switches (ATS), Batteries, Emergency Diesel Generators & Load Banks.         Knowledge of power quality analysis.          Strong experience with Word, Excel and PowerPoint.          Ability to effectively write electrical commissioning scripts, daily reports, and final commissioning reports.         Experience in 1 or more of the following:          o Data Centre construction / commissioning         o Electrical switching operations         o Equipment inspections         o Low and/or medium voltage equipment commissioning         o LEED commissioning         o Factory Witness Test / Factory Acceptance Test attendances         o Leading electrical commissioning processes         o Equipment/ facility handover         Data Center facilities operations experience is desired, but not essentail               ?         Other Requirements:                   Excellent oral and written English is required         Extensive travel may be required (75%)         Candidates must have a Passport or the ability to immediately get a Passport.         Work under construction site conditions

column2: Manager,  Engineering   India        (      Job Number:          APA014C9    )          Work Locations      :          Hilton - Regional Office - India            16th Floor,  Two Horizon Centre,         Sector 43 Golf Course Road,  DLF Phase V            Gurugram        122002                    The Manager,  Engineering   India reports to the Senior Director,  Engineering and is part of the Architecture,  Design & Construction (AD&C) team in India who collectively makes key strategic decisions for Managed and Franchised development projects for all brands.  You are responsible for providing MEP & FLS  (Mechanical,  Electrical,  Plumbing,  and Fire & Life Safety) engineering support from project inception to hotel opening.  You will cover the India region and be responsible for focus-service,  full-service,  lifestyle,  and luxury hotel projects across all Hilton brands.           What will I be doing?     As the Manager,  Engineering   India,  you will be responsible for performing the following tasks to the highest standards:      Work with Hilton s AD&C team to provide a review of MEP & FLS design documents for hotel projects for assigned areas within the India region.     Assist Project Managers in meeting engineering requirements initiated by the current Property Improvement Plan (PIP) for existing hotels,  proposed hotel conversions,  and proposed adaptive reuse properties.     Review 50% and 100% Engineering CD (Construction Document) for all MEP & FLS systems for compliance with Brand Standards and good design practice.  Verify that comments from the engineering design reviews have been incorporated in the final CDs before the construction starts.      Assist the AD&C team and guide the incorporation of ESG (Environmental and Sustainability Governance) and Energy and Water Efficiency strategies in the project design.     Review primary construction submittals and shop drawings in detail to ensure compliance with Hilton standards and prototype drawings.     Participate proactively in VE (Value Engineering) coordination and review to ensure project efficient and cost-effective construction practices while meeting Brand Standard requirements and best industry practices.     Visit projects (as needed) during construction to ensure compliance with the submitted and approved plans and CDs.  Address concerns immediately,  in person,  while at the site,  and provide detailed written correspondence following the site visit.     Continuously review engineering requirements and changes in the Brand Standards and provide recommendations for updates and changes to adapt to best industry practices and regional particularities.                                 What are we looking for?    A Manager,  Engineering   India serving Hilton Brands is always working on behalf of our Guests and working with other Team Members.  To successfully fill this role,  you should maintain the attitude,  behaviors,  skills,  and values that follow:      Professional Bachelor of Science degree in an Engineering subject area,  trade degree in a specific technical field relating to building Engineering (Mechanical or Electrical).     Licensed Professional Engineer.     7-10 years of experience in the design and construction administration of HVAC,  Plumbing,  Fire Protection,  and Electrical systems.     A minimum of five (5) years of hospitality experience is preferred,  including lead design roles in new construction and renovation projects.     Experience and knowledge of sustainable design,  energy efficiency,  and operations principles.     Proven leadership skills,  strong work/ethic,  adaptability,  and flexibility.     Ability to direct collaborative efforts of resources throughout the Hilton organization,  including internal resources,  external resources,  and other constituent groups as appropriate with the aim of furthering Company goals.     Ability to lead change,  resolve issues,  and ensure collaboration within teams and/or units,  including maintaining the highest standards of ethical conduct and integrity.     Ability to take the initiative to identify,  prioritize,  and implement all elements required for the team to fulfill responsibilities in keeping with core strategic goals.     Strong problem-solving skills,  including the ability to optimally address any issue in collaboration with others as appropriate.     Proficient in English and Hindi,  both verbal and written communication skills.     Ability to travel as required.             What will it be like to work for Hilton?      Hilton is the leading global hospitality company,  spanning the lodging sector from luxurious full-service hotels and resorts to extended-stay suites and mid-priced hotels.  For nearly a century,  Hilton has offered business and leisure travelers the finest in accommodations,  service,  amenities and value.  Hilton is dedicated to continuing its tradition of providing exceptional guest experiences across its global brands.  Our vision to fill the earth with the light and warmth of hospitality unites us as a team to create remarkable hospitality experiences around the world every day.  And,  our amazing Team Members are at the heart of it all!                    Job      :        Architecture,  Design,  and Development          Schedule      :        Full-time

column2: Dear Engineer We are hiring Estimation Engineer for big Engineering and Construction Company. Job Description Estimation engineers are financial detectives for the engineering world. They  work on  determining the cost and time required to complete engineering projects  by  meticulously analyzing project details and  historical data. Preparing project cost estimates:  This involves working with clients and project managers to understand the project's scope, then using their knowledge of engineering principles and costing software to create detailed breakdowns of expected expenses. Analyzing data:  Estimation engineers spend a lot of time researching material costs, labor rates, and historical project data to inform their estimates. They excel at identifying trends and making accurate predictions. Collaboration:  They collaborate with various teams like design and procurement to ensure their estimates are realistic and account for all aspects of the project. Staying updated:  The industry and technologies are constantly evolving, so estimation engineers need to stay updated on the latest cost factors and engineering software. Salary : 15 - 35 LPA Experience : 8 - 20 Years Job Type : Full Time
column11: Estimation, Engineering, Estimation Engineering

column2: A Site Engineer, also known as a Construction Site Engineer or Field Engineer, is a professional who oversees construction projects at the site level     They play a critical role in ensuring the successful execution of construction plans and coordinating various activities on-site       Here are some key responsibilities of a Site Engineer:       Project Planning and Execution: The Site Engineer works closely with project managers and stakeholders to understand project requirements, timelines, and specifications     They contribute to the development of project plans, schedules, and budgets     They ensure that construction activities are executed according to the plans and monitor progress to meet project milestones     Site Supervision: The Site Engineer is responsible for overseeing construction activities on-site     They manage and supervise the construction crew, contractors, and subcontractors, ensuring compliance with safety regulations, quality standards, and project specifications     They monitor and control work progress, resolve any issues or conflicts that arise, and ensure efficient utilization of resources     Quality Control: The Site Engineer ensures that construction work meets the required quality standards     They conduct regular inspections, perform quality checks, and ensure adherence to approved construction drawings and specifications     They identify and address any quality-related issues or deficiencies promptly     Material and Equipment Management: The Site Engineer is involved in managing construction materials, equipment, and resources on-site     They coordinate with suppliers, track inventory, and ensure timely availability of materials and equipment as per project requirements     They also oversee the proper handling, storage, and usage of materials and equipment to minimize wastage and ensure safety     Documentation and Reporting: The Site Engineer maintains accurate and up-to-date project documentation     They prepare daily or weekly progress reports, record site activities, maintain records of work orders, change orders, and RFIs (Requests for Information)     They also document any issues, incidents, or variations from the original plans and report them to the project team
column11: Supervisor, Quality standards, Compliance, Project documentation, construction site, Site supervision, Project planning, Manager Quality Control, Management, Inventory

Conduct tests and analysis on construction materials, such as concrete and steel. Train and educate construction teams on proper quality control procedures and practices. Requirements Bachelor's degree in mechanical or civil engineering. Proven experience as a QA/QC Engineer in the construction industry. Strong knowledge of mechanical and civil engineering principles and standards. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. Attention to detail and a high level of accuracy. Strong communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced and dynamic environment. Professional certifications in quality control and engineering would be an advantage.

column2: We are looking for an experienced (2-5 years) Safety Engineer/ QC Engineer for Building Construction Works at Jodhpur, Kurukshetra and various other site locations across North India(Haryana, Rajasthan, Punjab, NCR, etc).  Safety Engineer  at a construction site is responsible for ensuring the health and safety of all workers, visitors, and the general public at the construction site. This includes: Developing, implementing, and enforcing safety policies, procedures, and programs to ensure compliance with safety regulations. Conducting regular safety inspections of the construction site to identify and address potential hazards, unsafe conditions, and non-compliance with safety regulations. Collaborating with project managers, engineers, and contractors to develop and maintain safety plans and emergency response procedures. Providing safety training/guidance to construction personnel on safe work practices, and proper use of PPE. Investigating and documenting safety incidents, accidents, and near-misses, and recommending corrective actions to prevent future occurrences. Monitoring and evaluating the effectiveness of safety programs and initiatives, and implementing continuous improvement measures to enhance safety performance. Conducting job hazard analyses and risk assessments to identify and mitigate potential safety risks. Communicating with clients, and other stakeholders to ensure that safety requirements are met. Maintaining safety records, reports, and documentation in compliance with regulatory requirements and industry standards. Participating in safety committees, meetings, and training sessions to promote a culture of safety awareness and accountability among all construction site personnel.

Identify and resolve any discrepancies or issues in the drawings. Documentation: Prepare and maintain documentation related to drawings, including revision logs, drawing lists, and other project records. Communication: Effectively communicate with team members and stakeholders to clarify requirements, discuss design options, and address any concerns or challenges related to drafting and design. Seek opportunities to improve processes and workflows to enhance efficiency and quality in drafting operations. column1: Vice President/ Senior Project Manager - Civil
column2: As a Vice President/Senior Project Manager in Civil Engineering, you would typically be responsible for overseeing a variety of construction projects, ensuring they're completed safely, on time, and within budget. Here's a breakdown of some key responsibilities and skills: Project Management : You'll be responsible for planning, executing, and closing projects. This involves creating project plans, setting timelines, allocating resources, and managing budgets. Team Leadership : You'll lead a team of engineers, architects, and other professionals involved in the project. This requires excellent leadership and communication skills to ensure everyone is aligned and working towards the project goals. Client Relations : Building and maintaining strong relationships with clients is crucial. You'll be the main point of contact for clients, addressing their concerns, providing updates, and ensuring their needs are met throughout the project. Technical Expertise : A deep understanding of civil engineering principles and practices is essential. You'll need to review technical drawings, resolve design issues, and ensure that all work meets industry standards and regulations. Risk Management : Identifying and mitigating risks is a key aspect of project management. You'll need to anticipate potential issues, develop contingency plans, and take proactive steps to minimize disruptions to the project. Contract Negotiation : You may be involved in negotiating contracts with clients, subcontractors, and vendors. This requires strong negotiation skills and a thorough understanding of legal and financial terms. Quality Control : Ensuring quality throughout the project is essential. You'll be responsible for conducting regular inspections, reviewing workmanship, and implementing quality control measures to maintain high standards. Financial Management : Managing project budgets and finances is a critical aspect of the role. You'll need to track expenses, monitor cash flow, and make strategic decisions to keep the project financially viable.

column2: CAI is seeking motivated Building Commissioning/Data Centre Electrical Lead professionals to support Data Centre projects across the APAC Region. These are full-time opportunities with competitive compensation and benefits which include: up to 15% retirement contribution, medical insurance for employee and eligible dependents, dental insurance, life and disability insurance, maternity coverage for employee or spouse and financial support for both internal and external professional education. CAI is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.         As consultants to the entire industry, our employee owners are driven by the challenge and constant diversity of assignments, while having the stability of a company that has never had a lay off. On any given day we could be responsible for a myriad of things involved in starting a facility, equipment startup and test script writing and execution, SATs, walk downs, FWT / FATs, burn in tests and development of summary reports at the client site.          Lead Electrical Engineers will work as part of the CAI Data Centre / Building Commissioning team and be responsible for the commissioning of mission critical electrical equipment, safe electrical work practices, facility turnover, and issue resolution. Data Centre/ Building Commissioning professionals develop and execute the commissioning tests to demonstrate to the customer that vendor equipment is correctly installed and set to work, support enhanced design reviews, and consult on submission of LEED qualification packages. Duties may be increased as experience and skill allow                     Qualifications     :                   Bachelor s degree in electrical or equivalent           Minimum of 12 years Building or Data Center Commissioning experience       .         Knowledge of OSHA and NFPA 70E safety requirements.         Good written and spoken communication skills.         Ability to read and interpret electrical schematics and specifications.         Knowledge of Data Center design concepts.         Knowledge and commissioning experience with Electrical Distribution Switchgear, Substations, Uninterruptable Power Sources (UPS), Automatic Transfer Switches (ATS), Batteries, Emergency Diesel Generators & Load Banks.         Knowledge of power quality analysis.          Strong experience with Word, Excel and PowerPoint.          Ability to effectively write electrical commissioning scripts, daily reports, and final commissioning reports.         Experience in 1 or more of the following:          o Data Centre construction / commissioning         o Electrical switching operations         o Equipment inspections         o Low and/or medium voltage equipment commissioning         o LEED commissioning         o Factory Witness Test / Factory Acceptance Test attendances         o Leading electrical commissioning processes         o Equipment/ facility handover         Data Center facilities operations experience is desired, but not essentail               ?         Other Requirements:                   Excellent oral and written English is required         Extensive travel may be required (75%)         Candidates must have a Passport or the ability to immediately get a Passport.         Work under construction site conditions

column2: The Detailing Engineer will be responsible for preparing construction drawings, shipper, fabrication, and shop drawings. The role requires proficiency in AutoCAD and the ability to work on AUTOCAD. The incumbent will contribute to the development of detailed structural designs and collaborate with various stakeholders to ensure accurate and high-quality drawings.       Job Responsibilities:         Prepare construction drawings, shipper, fabrication, and shop drawings in accordance with project requirements.       Utilize AutoCAD software to create detailed structural drawings, ensuring accuracy, completeness, and adherence to relevant codes and standards.       Collaborate with architects, engineers, and other project team members to understand design specifications and incorporate necessary changes into the drawings.       Review and interpret technical drawings, blueprints, and specifications to extract essential information for the detailing process.       Incorporate design modifications and revisions as per customer feedback and project requirements.       Ensure that drawings are delivered within the defined timelines and meet the quality standards.       Coordinate with project managers, site engineers, and fabricators to resolve any design-related issues during the construction phase.       Keep up-to-date with industry trends, advancements in detailing software, and best practices to enhance efficiency and accuracy in the detailing process.       Maintain proper documentation of all drawings, revisions, and design changes.       Adhere to safety guidelines and quality control procedures throughout the detailing process.         Candidate Requirements:         Age Range: Below 32 years.       Minimum 3-8 years of experience in detailing steel structures using AutoCAD, preferably in the Pre-Engineered Buildings (PEB), conventional Structural Steel Industry, or Structural Consultants.       Proficiency in AutoCAD and a strong understanding of other software tools like MS Office.       Thorough knowledge of steel detailing practices and the ability to develop drawings based on customer requirements.       Hardworking, dedicated, and able to work well under pressure to meet project deadlines.       Excellent communication skills and the ability to understand and fulfill organizational requirements.       Strong attention to detail and problem-solving abilities.       ITI/Diploma/B.E (Civil/Mech.) qualification is required.         This job description outlines the responsibilities and requirements of a Detailing Engineer. The role involves creating detailed construction, fabrication, and shop drawings using AutoCAD, collaborating with project teams, and ensuring the accuracy and quality of drawings. The incumbent should possess relevant experience, technical knowledge, and strong communication skills to excel in this position.

column2: Manager,  Engineering   India        (      Job Number:          APA014C9    )          Work Locations      :          Hilton - Regional Office - India            16th Floor,  Two Horizon Centre,         Sector 43 Golf Course Road,  DLF Phase V            Gurugram        122002                    The Manager,  Engineering   India reports to the Senior Director,  Engineering and is part of the Architecture,  Design & Construction (AD&C) team in India who collectively makes key strategic decisions for Managed and Franchised development projects for all brands.  You are responsible for providing MEP & FLS  (Mechanical,  Electrical,  Plumbing,  and Fire & Life Safety) engineering support from project inception to hotel opening.  You will cover the India region and be responsible for focus-service,  full-service,  lifestyle,  and luxury hotel projects across all Hilton brands.           What will I be doing?     As the Manager,  Engineering   India,  you will be responsible for performing the following tasks to the highest standards:      Work with Hilton s AD&C team to provide a review of MEP & FLS design documents for hotel projects for assigned areas within the India region.     Assist Project Managers in meeting engineering requirements initiated by the current Property Improvement Plan (PIP) for existing hotels,  proposed hotel conversions,  and proposed adaptive reuse properties.     Review 50% and 100% Engineering CD (Construction Document) for all MEP & FLS systems for compliance with Brand Standards and good design practice.  Verify that comments from the engineering design reviews have been incorporated in the final CDs before the construction starts.      Assist the AD&C team and guide the incorporation of ESG (Environmental and Sustainability Governance) and Energy and Water Efficiency strategies in the project design.     Review primary construction submittals and shop drawings in detail to ensure compliance with Hilton standards and prototype drawings.     Participate proactively in VE (Value Engineering) coordination and review to ensure project efficient and cost-effective construction practices while meeting Brand Standard requirements and best industry practices.     Visit projects (as needed) during construction to ensure compliance with the submitted and approved plans and CDs.  Address concerns immediately,  in person,  while at the site,  and provide detailed written correspondence following the site visit.     Continuously review engineering requirements and changes in the Brand Standards and provide recommendations for updates and changes to adapt to best industry practices and regional particularities.                                 What are we looking for?    A Manager,  Engineering   India serving Hilton Brands is always working on behalf of our Guests and working with other Team Members.  To successfully fill this role,  you should maintain the attitude,  behaviors,  skills,  and values that follow:      Professional Bachelor of Science degree in an Engineering subject area,  trade degree in a specific technical field relating to building Engineering (Mechanical or Electrical).     Licensed Professional Engineer.     7-10 years of experience in the design and construction administration of HVAC,  Plumbing,  Fire Protection,  and Electrical systems.     A minimum of five (5) years of hospitality experience is preferred,  including lead design roles in new construction and renovation projects.     Experience and knowledge of sustainable design,  energy efficiency,  and operations principles.     Proven leadership skills,  strong work/ethic,  adaptability,  and flexibility.     Ability to direct collaborative efforts of resources throughout the Hilton organization,  including internal resources,  external resources,  and other constituent groups as appropriate with the aim of furthering Company goals.     Ability to lead change,  resolve issues,  and ensure collaboration within teams and/or units,  including maintaining the highest standards of ethical conduct and integrity.     Ability to take the initiative to identify,  prioritize,  and implement all elements required for the team to fulfill responsibilities in keeping with core strategic goals.     Strong problem-solving skills,  including the ability to optimally address any issue in collaboration with others as appropriate.     Proficient in English and Hindi,  both verbal and written communication skills.     Ability to travel as required.             What will it be like to work for Hilton?      Hilton is the leading global hospitality company,  spanning the lodging sector from luxurious full-service hotels and resorts to extended-stay suites and mid-priced hotels.  For nearly a century,  Hilton has offered business and leisure travelers the finest in accommodations,  service,  amenities and value.  Hilton is dedicated to continuing its tradition of providing exceptional guest experiences across its global brands.  Our vision to fill the earth with the light and warmth of hospitality unites us as a team to create remarkable hospitality experiences around the world every day.  And,  our amazing Team Members are at the heart of it all!                    Job      :        Architecture,  Design,  and Development          Schedule      :        Full-time

column2: Manages all egneering/maintenance operations,  including maintaining the building,  grounds and physical plant with particular attention towards safety,  security and asset protection.    Accountable for managing the budget,  capital expenditure projects,  preventative maintenance and eneg conservation.    Responsible for maintaining regulatory requirements.    Assists in leading the emegncy response team for all facility issues.     CANDIDATE PROFILE             Education and Experience        High school diploma or GED; 3 years experience in the egneering and maintenance or related professional area; technical training in HVAC-R/electrical/plumbing.   OR      2-year degree from an accredited university in Building and Construction,  Engineering,  Mechanics,  or related major; 1 year experience in the egneering and maintenance or related professional area; technical training in HVAC-R/electrical/plumbing.     CORE WORK ACTIVITIES            Managing Engineering Operations and Budgets        Manages the physical plant including equipment,  refrigeration,  HVAC,  plumbing,  water treatment and electrical systems.     Ensures regulatory compliance to facility regulations and safety standards.     Manages and controls heat,  light and power and recommends current best methods for eneg conservation and economical facility operations.     Develops specifications and requirements for service contracts and administers such contracts to support building needs.     Distributes preventive maintenance and repair work orders and monitors timeliness and quality of completion.     Oversees and directs the maintenance of grounds,  guestrooms,  public space,  restaurants,  property vehicles and recreational facilities.     Develops a long term plan for preventative maintenance and asset protection and overseeing execution of plan.     Develops project plans in accordance with renovation or new construction needs.     Contacts contractors for bids and supervising construction to ensure timely completion of projects within budgetary guidelines.     Builds positive relationships with external customers such as city building/zoning department,  fire prevention bureau and vendors.     Ensures fire crew has complete understanding of all procedures,  equipment and alarms.     Performs monthly property inspection to ensure buildings and grounds are maintained in excellent condition.     Conducts guest room and common area inspection to ensuregest satisfaction.     Inspects and evaluates the physical condition of facilities in order to determine the type of work required.     Recommends or arranges for additional services such as painting,  repair work,  renovations,  and the replacement of furnishings and equipment.     Selects and orders or purchasing new equipment,  supplies,  and furnishings.     Manages parts and equipment inventory.     Maintaining Property Standards        Ensures building and equipment licenses and certifications are current.     Maintains property life safety systems (fire fighting equipment,  sprinkler systems and alarm systems).     Ensuring Exceptional Customer Service        Displays leadership in guest hospitality,  exemplifying excellent customer service and creating a positive atmosphere for guest relations.     Reviews comment cards,  guest satisfaction results and other data to identify areas of improvement.     Shares plans with property leadership and ensuring corrective action is taken to continuously improvegest satisfaction.     Strives to improve service performance.

column2: Design Standards: The candidate will be responsible for developing designs in adherence to industry standards.     Team Leadership: They will lead a drainage team and effectively manage project deliveries.     Proactive Project Leadership: The role entails proactive leadership of projects, taking independent initiatives to drive project deliveries.     Collaboration: Regular interactions with lead regions and the GEC team are expected, fostering open discussions and collaborations.     Technical Proficiency: The candidate should demonstrate technical prowess as an independent problem solver.     Capacity Building: One of the responsibilities is to enhance the teams capabilities to attract new business opportunities and ensure 100% quality in processes, training, and checklists.     Knowledge Sharing: Sharing knowledge and facilitating knowledge transfer within the wider team, along with the implementation of industry best practices in project deliveries, is a crucial aspect of this role.             Required Specific Competencies         The candidate will be responsible for designing projects in line with industry standards.     They will lead a drainage team and oversee project deliveries.     This role involves proactive project leadership, taking independent actions to ensure successful project outcomes.     Collaboration with lead regions and the GEC team is essential, promoting open discussions and teamwork.     The candidate should possess strong technical skills, focus on team capacity building, and actively share knowledge while implementing industry best practices for project excellence.             Qualifications Experience:         Experience :         The candidate should have extensive experience of at least 6+ years in developing sustainable drainage schemes for major infrastructure projects in various land usage patterns, such as airports, highways, rail networks, and site developments.     They should also have experience in design management and project management activities, with a proven track record of successfully delivering drainage projects in the UK region.     The candidate should be recognized in the field and with clients, demonstrating their ability to manage project deliveries independently from concept to construction stages.     They should possess knowledge and application of relevant British Standards, be aware of construction in the drainage field and the latest technologies, equipment, and risk assessment and mitigative measures.     Additionally, the candidate should have proficiency in relevant design software applications, BIM software like Civil 3D and AutoCAD, and strong communication and mentoring skills to manage clients and project teams effectively, including experience with Common Data Environment and digital aspects/BIM applications.         Qualification :         Civil Engineering Graduate with a Post-Graduation degree (desirable) in Water Resources/Environmental Engineering

column1: Job Opening For Quantity Surveyor (QS) with Planswift Expertise
column2: Job Title: Quantity Surveyor (QS) with Planswift Expertise Education: Bachelors Degree in Civil Engineering Experience: 12 - 18 Years Location: Head Office, Hyderabad Job Description: We are seeking a skilled Quantity Surveyor (QS) with expertise in Planswift software to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for utilizing Planswift to perform accurate quantity takeoffs, cost estimations, and planning activities for construction projects. As a QS with Planswift proficiency, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the success and profitability of our projects by providing detailed and precise estimates, as well as contributing to effective project planning and management. Utilize Planswift software to perform quantity takeoffs from digital drawings, including measurements of lengths, areas, volumes, and counts of various construction materials. Generate detailed cost estimates for construction projects based on Planswift quantity takeoffs, considering labor, materials, equipment, and other associated expenses. Collaborate with project stakeholders, including architects, engineers, contractors, and subcontractors, to review plans, specifications, and project requirements. Analyse and interpret project documents to identify scope, specifications, and potential risks or opportunities for cost savings. Assist in the preparation of project budgets and bids by providing accurate quantity and cost information derived from Planswift. Contribute to project planning activities, including scheduling, resource allocation, and procurement planning, to ensure projects are delivered on time and within budget. Monitor project progress and update quantity takeoffs and cost estimates as necessary throughout the project lifecycle. Conduct regular cost analysis and variance reporting to identify discrepancies between estimated and actual costs, and recommend corrective actions as needed. Stay updated on industry trends, best practices, and advancements in construction technology, particularly related to quantity surveying and estimating software like Planswift. Provide support and guidance to junior QS staff on the use of Planswift and best practices for quantity surveying and estimating.
column11: Planswift, Material Takeoff, Quantitly Surveyor, Quantity Takeoff

Troubleshoot any operational problems that may arise during production and take corrective actions to minimize disruptions. Maintain cleanliness and orderliness of the plant area, including equipment, storage areas, and surrounding premises.

column2: Roles and Responsibilities     Designation  : Construction Planning Engineer- 1 Opening(s). Experience  : 07 to 10 years Industry Type  : Real Estate/ Property/Construction Role  : Planning Engineer  Functional Area  : Planning Department Qualification  : Diploma /Degree The  Planning Engineer  is responsible for executing the planning and programme support services on all assigned projects teams.  The role includes assisting the management team with the administration of the departments internal planning deliverables.  A key function of the Planning Engineer is to ensure that Design & Engineering Site Operations best practices are being adhered to throughout all projects This role also includes promoting strong commercial and contract management practices to ensure a common understanding and approach is achieved on all assigned projects.  Responsibilities  The key roles and responsibilities of the Planning Engineer include: Addressing all planning requirements on assigned projects. Addressing all progress monitoring functions on assigned projects Contribute to the improvement of existing planning and progress monitoring systems Ensure project controls are established and maintained on all projects Review of contractor programmes in accordance with the contract Provide assessment of Extension of Time claims Contribute to the programme sections with Monthly Reports Ensure all key issues are communicated effectively to Engineers / PMs Compile and maintain records of construction productivity data Provide contract administration support as required. Assist in the preparation of Engineers Determinations Assist with the review Interim Payment Schedules of contractor and vendors  Provide support for the establishment of project resource schedules Assist with the preparation and review of future bids Developing project master schedule, updating, monitoring and reviewing contractor construction schedules, submittals, material delivery, procurement logs and daily follow-up in addition to the necessary productivity measurement studies and associated corrective measures. Participating in contract administration Relationships The role will require liaison with the Site Managers, Resident Engineers, Project Controls Administrator, Contract Administrators, the Business Support Manager and the Design and estimation Unit. Compensation:  As per industry Standard .  Preferred:  Exposure/Experience of Lean Construction Management Principles
