column2: Nauvata Engineering Pvt Ltd is looking for Piping Lead Engineer to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      As a Piping Lead Engineer, you will be responsible for leading the design, engineering, and implementation of piping systems in various industrial projects, such as oil and gas facilities, chemical plants, power plants, and manufacturing plants      You'll oversee a team of piping engineers and designers, ensuring that piping layouts, specifications, and materials meet project requirements and industry standards      Your expertise will contribute to the successful execution of complex engineering projects from conception to completion        Responsibilities:        Project Leadership: Lead a team of piping engineers and designers in the execution of piping design projects, ensuring adherence to project schedules, budgets, and quality standards      Piping Design: Develop piping layouts, isometric drawings, and specifications in accordance with project requirements, codes, and standards (eg, ASME, API, ASTM)      Material Selection: Select appropriate piping materials based on project specifications, process requirements, and environmental factors, considering factors such as corrosion resistance, temperature, and pressure      Technical Review: Review and approve piping designs, calculations, and documentation prepared by the engineering team, ensuring accuracy, completeness, and compliance with project requirements      Interdisciplinary Coordination: Collaborate with other engineering disciplines (eg, process, mechanical, structural) to integrate piping systems with overall plant design, resolving conflicts and ensuring system compatibility      Regulatory Compliance: Ensure compliance with relevant industry regulations, codes, and standards governing piping design, fabrication, and installation, such as ASME B313, API 570, and ANSI/ASME B16

column2: This role is part of Arcadis Global Excellence Centre (GEC) and will join our 3,000+ talented individuals working in India, Romania, and Philippines, in partnership with Arcadis offices globally. The GEC brings key capabilities and capacity to support our clients seamlessly around the world. For those in GEC there are options to be dedicated to one country; developing deep knowledge and strong relationships, as we'll as opportunities to be part of teams working truly globally as a centre of excellence, offering diversity and variety. Arcadians are by nature, globally minded and culturally aware, and Arcadis strongly believes in flexibility which enables change over time as your career progresses. The GEC model is we'll embedded in Arcadis, and the strong relationships that exist between our global offices are truly unique.                ?         Role Accountabilities:             To take on a key role within the Rail MEP services sector, providing leadership, technical advice, building technical capabilities and leading by example where appropriate.         To manage selected projects (or components of projects) meeting technical requirements, budgetary, quality, safety and timeframe targets, while exceeding Client expectations.         To promote and assist in brand building of Arcadis in India, thus helping recruitment process.         To actively participate and contribute to the GEC professional group and externally at seminars and conferences.         To build networks within the Rail building services industry.         Proactively managing selected projects (or components of projects), taking responsibility for resource allocation, managing the production of analysis and design (including drawings and reports), ensuring the integrity of the overall design (in collaboration with other design disciplines), quality assurance and client feedback          Providing input to the GEC sector strategy/business plans, as required and contributing towards its achievement.         Communicating with team members to ensure that they understand, and become engaged with, sector/discipline business plans.         Liaising with the Project Manager or Director and the client to keep informed of all developments, changes/modifications associated with the project.         Identifying opportunities and driving implementation of standardization strategies to enhance efficiencies at GEC.         Providing leadership, direction and technical advice to project team members, taking a proactive role in developing team members to their full potential, leading by example to achieve sector/divisional goals and championing a quality, innovative and entrepreneurial culture.          Being familiar with, and compliant with, relevant H & S and CDM regulations and to promote a culture of awareness within the team.         Training and development of team s technical capabilities.          Performing other duties and responsibilities assigned by your manager as required from time to time.             Qualifications & Experience:             B.E / B. Tech in Mechanical Engineering from a recognized University.          Chartered Engineer (CEng) with IET / CIBSE / IMechE.         15 to 20 Years experience in design of Mechanical Building services (HVAC, Plumbing & Firefighting) preferably UK/Rail projects.         Has solid domain knowledge in UK Building service industry.          Proven design experience; including concept, preliminary, detailed, construction phases         Ability to check and review technical specifications, design basis reports, etc          Has very good appreciation of health, safety and CDM aspects related to typical Rail systems project.         Ability to carry out design reviews independently.         Familiar with international codes, Network Rail and London Underground standards and practices related to UK Rail industry.         Experience within a consultancy environment specifically in the Rail / Metro industry.         Strong verbal and written communication skills in the English language, with good report writing, analytical and computer skills.         Ability to think in an innovative and entrepreneurial manner with good understanding of commercial aspects of a project.         Knowledge of code & standards and practices of Building services industry          Good motivation, influencing, people management and delegation skills         Client Focus - Understands Client s expectations and align accordingly.         Excellence - striving for technical excellence.         Trust - building and retaining relationships of trust with our clients and colleagues.         Teamwork - working together as a team for the Group, not just the individual.         Responsibility - taking responsibility for our performance and our safety.

column2: Skills           communication skill             Microsoft Office             Team Leadership                     Safety Planning: Develop and implement safety plans and procedures for the site based on regulatory requirements and industry best practices. This includes conducting risk assessments and identifying potential hazards specific to the site.     Safety Inspections: Regularly inspect the site to identify any safety hazards, unsafe practices, or equipment deficiencies. This involves inspecting scaffolding, machinery, electrical systems, and other site-specific elements to ensure compliance with safety standards.     Hazard Identification and Mitigation: Identify potential safety hazards and risks associated with the sites activities, processes, or equipment. Develop strategies to mitigate these hazards and implement control measures to minimize risks to workers and the environment.     Safety Training: Provide safety training to workers on the site. This includes conducting orientation sessions for new employees, delivering toolbox talks, and organizing specialized training programs for specific tasks or equipment usage. Promote a safety culture and ensure that workers are aware of and comply with safety regulations.     Incident Investigation: Investigate accidents, incidents, near misses, or safety breaches that occur on the site. Identify the root causes and contributing factors of these incidents and make recommendations to prevent similar occurrences in the future. Maintain incident records and report findings to management.     Safety Compliance: Ensure compliance with local, state, and federal safety regulations, as well as any applicable industry-specific standards. Stay updated on changes in safety regulations and ensure that the site remains in compliance.     Emergency Preparedness: Develop emergency response plans for the site and conduct drills or simulations to test the effectiveness of the plans. Coordinate with emergency services and ensure that appropriate first aid facilities and equipment are available on-site.     Communication and Collaboration: Collaborate with site managers, supervisors, and workers to promote a culture of safety and ensure that safety measures are integrated into daily operations. Communicate safety guidelines, provide training and guidance, and address safety concerns raised by workers.     Documentation and Reporting: Maintain accurate records of safety inspections, training sessions, incidents, and safety-related communications. Prepare reports on safety performance, trends, and areas for improvement. Provide regular updates to management on the sites safety status.                 Qualification : BE Civil / Diploma Civil

column2: What we live for: At Ashiana, we enable people to live a better life. The 15,500 homes we have built remind us of our responsibility towards our customers, investors, vendors, and society. Every day, we strive to deliver our homes on time, live up to the expectations we set, and continue to care for our residents and projects long after we have handed them over. Over the last 40 years, we are driven by bringing a smile of satisfaction to our residents in Jaipur, Gurugram, Pune, Chennai, Bhiwadi, etc. While we have received many recognition, including Forbes Best under a Billion, Most Caring Brand to the ??o. 1 Senior Living Developer??in the country, what we cherish most is when we go the extra mile to deliver happiness and comfort to our residents. Job Title: DGM Engineering Job Location:  Chennai How can you make an Impact? Execution of multistorey group housing projects including planning estimation, scheduling, team selection, quality & cost control etc. with on time delivery track record. Analyse & approve estimates, labor rates, item rates etc & monitor construction costs.  Develop and implement methods, construction checklists & conduct periodic audits at site to check adherence to construction guidelines & standards, quality, and safety measures for consistent operations across locations. Coordinate with consultants, services & architectural team to prepare a cost-effective design which is easy to execute & maintain. Will be responsible to hire, coach & mentor a team of project management engineers.  Audit project compliances as per relevant BIS Codes & NBC guidelines, building byelaws, environmental & labor laws etc.  Ensure optimal strength of man, material & machine on site to for timely delivery & monitor daily, monthly reports with periodic site visits.  Hands on knowledge of ERP software's, AutoCAD and MS Projects & MS Excel.  What are we looking for?  If you are a civil Engineer with 23-28 years of experience with a bachelor?? degree in Engineering (full time/regular from REC/Equivalent) and  Enjoy hiring, coaching & building a team and leading people with purpose,  Minimum 5-7yrs of site execution experience (mandatory) . Measure success by achieving both customer delight and consistently achieving numbers  Constantly seek to learn and find ways to keep yourself updated,  Believe in excellence and taking action quickly,

column2: Hi We are hiring Piping Engineer for big EPC Company Job Location : Remote or Mumbai, Pune, Chennai, Hyderabad, Bengaluru, Delhi/NCR Experience : 5 - 20 Years Salary : 10 - 40 LPA Piping Engineer is responsible for the design, layout, installation, and maintenance of piping systems in various industrial facilities, including oil and gas refineries, chemical plants, power plants, and manufacturing plants. Ensure that piping systems meet safety standards, regulatory requirements, and project specifications while optimizing efficiency and reliability. Key Responsibilities: Piping Design and Layout:  Develop detailed piping designs, layouts, and schematics based on project requirements, process specifications, and engineering standards. Utilize piping design software and CAD tools to create 2D and 3D models of piping systems, equipment, and components. Consider factors such as fluid flow, pressure, temperature, and material compatibility in design calculations. Material Selection and Specification:  Select appropriate materials for piping components, including pipes, fittings, valves, and supports, based on process conditions, operating parameters, and corrosion considerations. Specify material grades, sizes, and specifications to ensure compatibility with process fluids, environmental conditions, and regulatory requirements. Piping Installation and Construction:  Oversee the installation, assembly, and fabrication of piping systems in accordance with design drawings, isometric diagrams, and piping specifications. Coordinate with construction teams, contractors, and vendors to ensure that piping installations meet quality standards, safety protocols, and project schedules. Conduct site inspections and provide technical guidance during installation activities. Piping Stress Analysis:  Perform piping stress analysis using software tools to evaluate the structural integrity, stability, and performance of piping systems under various operating conditions, including thermal expansion, pressure loads, and seismic events. Identify potential stress concentrations, fatigue points, or design deficiencies and recommend corrective measures to mitigate risks. Code Compliance:  Ensure that piping designs and installations comply with applicable industry codes, standards, and regulations, such as ASME B31.3, API 570, ANSI/ASME, and local jurisdictional requirements. Interpret and apply code requirements related to pipe sizing, material selection, welding procedures, and pressure testing protocols. Quality Assurance and Inspection:  Develop and implement quality assurance procedures, inspection protocols, and testing protocols to verify the integrity and functionality of piping systems. Conduct visual inspections, pressure tests, leak tests, and non-destructive testing (NDT) to ensure compliance with quality standards and project specifications. Document inspection results and prepare reports for internal and external stakeholders. Project Coordination:  Collaborate with project managers, process engineers, mechanical engineers, and other stakeholders to coordinate piping design and construction activities within overall project schedules and budgets. Participate in project meetings, design reviews, and construction coordination meetings to address technical issues, resolve conflicts, and ensure project objectives are met. Safety and Environmental Compliance:  Prioritize safety and environmental considerations in piping design, installation, and operation. Identify potential hazards, safety risks, and environmental impacts associated with piping systems and implement mitigation measures to protect personnel, equipment, and the environment. Adhere to company safety policies, regulatory requirements, and industry best practices.
column11: Piping, Piping Design, Piping Engineering, Piping Layout

column2: Roles and Responsibilities   As a Maintenance Planner specializing in Civil and Structural maintenance within the oil and gas industry, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the integrity, reliability, and safety of our infrastructure. Your responsibilities will include: Planning and Scheduling:  Develop detailed maintenance plans and schedules for civil and structural assets based on equipment requirements, regulatory standards, and operational needs. Asset Inspection and Assessment:  Conduct regular inspections and assessments of civil and structural assets to identify maintenance needs, prioritize tasks, and recommend necessary repairs or upgrades. Resource Coordination:  Coordinate with maintenance teams, contractors, and suppliers to ensure timely availability of resources, materials, and equipment required for maintenance activities. Budget Management:  Assist in the development and management of maintenance budgets, including forecasting costs, tracking expenses, and optimizing spending to maximize efficiency and cost-effectiveness. Risk Management:  Identify potential risks and hazards associated with civil and structural assets, develop mitigation strategies, and ensure compliance with safety regulations and industry standards. Documentation and Reporting:  Maintain accurate records of maintenance activities, including work orders, inspection reports, and equipment histories. Prepare regular reports and updates on maintenance performance, KPIs, and key metrics. Continuous Improvement:  Drive continuous improvement initiatives to enhance the effectiveness and efficiency of maintenance processes, optimize asset performance, and minimize downtime. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering, Structural Engineering, or related field. 2-7 years of experience in maintenance planning, preferably within the oil and gas industry. Proficiency in maintenance management software (e.g., SAP PM, IBM Maximo) and Microsoft Office Suite. Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret technical drawings, schematics, and engineering specifications. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively across multidisciplinary teams. Knowledge of relevant regulatory requirements, industry standards, and best practices in civil and structural maintenance. Job Benefits & Perks
column11: Maintenance Planning, Civil Maintenance, Maintenance Engineering, Planning Management

column1: Manager-EHS, Hosur Location, ME in Environmental Science/Engineering
column2: ME in Environmental Science/ ME in Environmental Engineering is must. Tamil is must. 1. Risk Assessment Risk assessment involves systematically examining a workplace to identify hazards, assess injury severity and likelihood, and implement control measures.  Pollution Board: Coordination with Pollution Control Boards is mandatory. 2. Safety Policies And Procedures Safety policies and procedures form the backbone of safety management in any organization. In the construction context, they are particularly important due to the high-risk nature of the work.  3. Training And Education Training and education are vital for ensuring safety on construction sites. As a Construction Safety Officer, your role would involve organizing and delivering various training programs.  4. Regulatory Compliance Ensuring compliance with safety regulations is one of the most important aspects of a Construction Safety Officers role. These regulations are designed to protect workers health and safety, and non-compliance can result in severe penalties, including fines and legal action.  5. Emergency Response Planning A well-prepared emergency response plan is essential for the safety of everyone on a construction site. Developing and implementing these plans is critical to your role as a Construction Safety Officer. 6. Documentation Documentation is a fundamental responsibility of a Construction Safety Officer. It ensures that theres a record of all safety-related activities, which can be critical for legal compliance, demonstrating due diligence, and learning from past experiences.  If You are interested, please share your updated profile to revathy.h@avigna.space. Thanks & Regards, Revathy H Asst Manager - HR & Admin M : 8861740654

column2: The      Piping Field Engineer is responsible for activities relating to construction engineering within the Piping/Mechanical discipline.          This position will be responsible for a variety of construction tasks utilizing      codes and standards related to pipe, equipment and machinery installations.          Responsibilities include the development of work plans, interpreting vendor installation drawings and manuals, coordinating materials, performing and documenting inspections, reporting progress, and resolving conflicts in design and construction related to the installation and testing of mechanical equipment and piping commodities.          This position requires good planning and organizational skills, ability to perform detailed inspections and the ability to produce documentation.      Duties and Responsibilities:                        Coordinate with engineering on constructability and design issues relating to mechanical equipment and related systems.            Develop work plans, coordinate materials, perform and document inspections, report progress, and resolve conflicts in design and construction related to the installation and testing of piping/mechanical equipment and commodities.            Provide leadership in a team-based environment.            Responsible for the activities of assigned construction engineers.            Direct the preparation of material take offs for field purchased piping material and equipment.            Review requisitions for field purchases.            Support field procurement in inspection and receipt of piping and pipe support materials.            Review the preparation of construction drawings and schedules.            Assist Field Engineers and Superintendents in the interpretation of design and vendor drawings, monitor pipe commodity delivery, storage, and installation.            Interface with survey team for laser scanning, as-building and general layout for equipment and piping installations.            Review specifications, procedures, inspection reports, delivery schedules, vendor manuals and technical data.            Responsible for development of pressure test packages, performance, witnessing and documentation of test acceptance.            Coordinate with Subcontractor work efforts and interfaces with client personnel as required.            Interface with the Construction Automation Group and Project Controls. Perform take offs from Issued For Construction drawings, provide input to the quantity tracking applications and reports weekly installed quantities to Project Controls.            Perform constructability reviews of engineering design, resolves issues with engineering and fabricator.            Work within TEAM. Works to verify accurate data from engineering and suppliers.            Take an active lead in promoting a safe work environment and be committed to ATMAN s Zero Accident Program.            Participate in and foster a work environment that is based upon openness, trust, communication, teamwork empowerment, innovation, and satisfaction.                                      Skills Required:                      Ideal candidate will have a minimum of 7 years of working experience in EPC project execution. Experience in Food Beverage industry will be preferred.                        Qualifications and Skills                                            Basic Qualifications:                Bachelor s degree in Engineering, Construction, or a related subject from an accredited university and 1 year of Field Engineering or related experience or, in lieu of a degree, 7+ years of directly related experience.            Be physically able to conduct field inspections and participate in project walk-downs which may require the following activities: extensive walking in and around a construction site, climbing ladders, climbing scaffolding, using fall protection and other personal protective equipment (PPE), walking on elevated platforms, walking on uneven surfaces, and maneuvering around very small and/or confined spaces.                          Minimum Qualifications:                Working in a field construction environment interpreting specification, procedures, vendor drawings and installation instructions, and codes.            Understanding piping PID s, isometrics drawings, pipe support drawings            Scoping, preparation, execution, and restoration of mechanical systems and equipment (motors, cranes, hoists, rails).            Working closely with diverse construction disciplines, craftsmen, and oversight organizations.            Experience with piping and pipe support installation and inspection and pressure testing of piping.            Experience with installation of mechanical equipment, piping and pipe supports.            Strong knowledge of ASME and related ASTM material standards and codes.            Strong ability to read, understand and interpret mechanical/piping installation/construction drawings.            Strong understanding of change management and configuration control processes.            Understanding of welding processes.            Technical knowledge of a specialized engineering discipline, cost, scheduling, and contracts administration relating to the construction of heavy industrial or commercial complexes.            Strong understanding construction/system completion walk-downs, pressure testing.            General awareness of environmental laws. Awareness of government compliance standards.            Knowledge of requirements for Lock Out Tag Out for safety.            Computer literate in word processing, spreadsheet, and database applications.            Experience working with, supervising, and administering subcontractors.                              Preferred Qualifications:                Possess      Construction knowledge preferred.            Knowledge of      Zero Accident Safety Program and familiar with current industry standards.            Familiarity with current industry quality standards.            Knowledge of project specific environmental compliance requirements.            Knowledge and experience of the piping guiding principles and core functions.

column2: Job Description:  We are seeking a detail-oriented and motivated Construction Quality Engineer to join our team. The ideal candidate will have 2-3 years of experience in quality assurance and quality control within the construction industry. The Construction Quality Engineer will be responsible for ensuring that construction projects meet quality standards, specifications, and regulatory requirements. Responsibilities: Conduct quality inspections and audits of construction sites, materials, and workmanship to identify deficiencies and ensure compliance with project requirements. Review construction plans, drawings, and specifications to verify accuracy and completeness, and identify potential quality issues. Monitor and document construction activities, including material deliveries, installations, and testing, to ensure adherence to quality standards and project specifications. Collaborate with project managers, engineers, architects, and subcontractors to address quality-related issues and implement corrective actions. Perform root cause analysis and develop solutions to resolve quality problems and prevent recurrence. Coordinate with third-party testing agencies and inspectors to ensure proper testing and inspection of materials and construction activities. Develop and implement quality control procedures and documentation, including inspection checklists, test plans, and quality assurance records. Conduct training sessions for construction personnel on quality requirements, procedures, and best practices. Participate in project meetings, progress reviews, and client presentations as needed.

column2: We are currently seeking a reliable Construction Manager to join our team in South America. In this role, you will be responsible for planning the construction for projects and overseeing their progress from start to finish in a timely and cost-effective manner. Your key responsibilities will include  Project Construction Planning, Control and Scheduling Management, Budget Management, Supervision and Coordination, Risk Management, Quality Control, Documentation and Reporting, Problem solving ability. With your keen attention to detail and strong organizational skills, you will ensure that all construction activities align with the established scope, timeline and budget. Role & responsibilities     Site Inspection : Conduct regular site visits to inspect progress, ensure compliance with safety regulations, and address any issues that arise. Coordination Meeting s: Hold meetings with subcontractors, engineers, architects, and other stakeholders to discuss project status, resolve issues, and plan upcoming tasks. Schedule Management : Monitor project schedules and adjust timelines as needed to ensure timely completion of tasks and adherence to project milestones. Material Procurement : Coordinate with suppliers/contractors to procure materials and equipment required for ongoing construction activities, ensuring timely delivery and quality standards. Quality Control : Conduct inspections to ensure that construction work meets quality standards and specifications. Address any deficiencies or deviations from the approved plans. Safety Management : Implement and enforce safety protocols to minimize the risk of accidents and injuries on the construction site. Conduct safety meetings and inspections to promote a safe working environment. Budget Tracking : Monitor project expenditures and track costs against the budget. Identify areas where costs can be optimized and implement cost-saving measures where possible. Contractor Bill Processing : To verify and process the contractor bills monthly.  Documentation : Maintain accurate records of project activities, including contracts, permits, change orders, daily logs, and progress reports. Ensure that all documentation is organized and up to date. Subcontractor Management : Coordinate with subcontractors to ensure that work is completed according to schedule and quality standards. Address any issues or disputes that arise with subcontractors. Client Communication : Communicate regularly with clients to provide updates on project progress, address any concerns or questions they may have, and ensure that their expectations are being met. Problem Solving : Identify and resolve issues that arise during construction, such as logistical challenges, design conflicts, or unexpected site conditions. Implement effective solutions to keep the project on track. Change Management : Manage change orders and revisions to the project scope, ensuring that any changes are properly documented, approved, and implemented in a timely manner. Team Leadership : Provide leadership and guidance to project team members, including subcontractors, foremen, and laborers. Delegate tasks and responsibilities effectively to ensure efficient project execution. Progress Reporting : Prepare and distribute regular progress reports to stakeholders, including clients, project owners, and senior management. Highlight key milestones, achievements, and upcoming activities. Continuous Improvement : Identify opportunities for process improvement and implement best practices to enhance project efficiency, productivity, and quality. Preferred candidate profile     Proven work experience in construction management Advanced knowledge of construction management processes, means and methods Expert knowledge of building products, construction details and relevant rules, regulations and quality standards Understanding of all facets of the construction process Familiarity with construction management software Competent in conflict and crisis management Excellent time and project management skills Degree in construction management, engineering or related field Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Good written, oral English, and presentation skills. Perks and benefits     Accommodation Health Insurance
column11: Team Management, Construction Management, Site Operations

column2: Job   Description: Senior   Quality   Manager   :   Irrigation   Project Profile Summary: The Senior Quality Manager in a construction company holds a pivotal role in overseeing and ensuring the adherence to high-quality standards throughout all stages of construction projects. Their primary responsibilities include developing and implementing quality assurance strategies, planning and executing quality control measures, managing supplier quality, training staff on quality protocols, addressing non-conformity, and ensuring compliance with regulations and client requirements. By effectively fulfilling these duties, the Senior Quality Manager plays a vital role in upholding the reputation of the company, enhancing customer satisfaction, and driving continuous improvement in construction processes and outcomes. Responsibilities: 1. Develop and implement comprehensive quality management systems and procedures tailored to the unique requirements of the irrigation project, ensuring alignment with industry standards, specifications, and regulatory requirements. 2. Lead and mentor a team of quality professionals, providing guidance, training, and support to ensure the effective execution of quality assurance and quality control activities throughout the project life cycle. 3. Collaborate with project managers, engineers, subcontractors, and suppliers to establish quality requirements, specifications, and acceptance criteria for materials, components, and construction activities related to the irrigation system. 4. Conduct regular quality inspections, audits, and reviews of project activities, ensuring compliance with established quality standards, specifications, and contractual requirements. 5. Implement robust quality control measures to monitor and verify the quality of workmanship, materials, and equipment used in the construction of the irrigation system, identifying and addressing any non-conformities or deviations promptly. 6. Develop and maintain quality documentation, including quality plans, inspection reports, test records, and non-conformance reports, ensuring accuracy, completeness, and traceability of quality-related information. 7. Lead root cause analysis investigations and corrective action processes to address quality issues, defects, or deficiencies, implementing preventive measures to prevent recurrence and minimize project risk. 8. Coordinate with external quality assurance and certification bodies as required to obtain necessary approvals, certifications, and compliance documentation for the irrigation project. 9. Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and quality metrics to track project quality performance, analyze trends, and identify opportunities for improvement, reporting findings to project stakeholders and management.  10. Drive continuous improvement initiatives to enhance project quality, efficiency, and effectiveness, leveraging lessons learned, best practices, and innovative technologies to optimize project outcomes. Requirements: 1. Bachelor's degree BE in civil engineering ,Construction Management. 2. Proficiency in project management software (e.g., Primavera P6, Microsoft Project) and Microsoft Office Suite. 3. Strong analytical skills and attention to detail, with the ability to interpret technical data and make informed decisions. 4. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively engage with diverse stakeholders. 5. Knowledge of irrigation systems, hydraulics, and water management principles. 6. Familiarity with relevant regulations, standards, and best practices in the irrigation industry. 7. Leadership qualities with a proven track record of successfully leading teams and delivering projects on time and within budget. Project   details: 1. Company Headquarter: Nagpur 2. Company: Infratech Construction Company 3. Project Name: Jigaon Project 4. Site location: Tal. Nandura, Dist.Buldana. Construction of Earthen Dam including spillway stilling basin, divide wall approach road, tail channel of Jigaon Project.
column11: Irrigation, Dams, Canals, Senior Quality Manager, Quality Audit, quality inspections, Quality Monitoring, Project Monitoring, Project Quality, Quality Control

column2: Role & responsibilities     The Construction Manager will be responsible for the end-to-end inception, execution,  commission, and handover of the T&D Site project to the client. They  will be able to independently handle all liaison, approvals,  cross-functional coordination, be a profit head, manage finances,  billing and collection, stakeholder management, resolution of local  issues, and solve ROW issues. The following are the key responsibilities  of the Construction Manager:   RESPONSIBILITIES:      * Oversee the entire construction project from inception to completion,  ensuring that the project is completed within the given timeline and  budget.      * Manage all aspects of the project, including planning, design,  procurement, construction, and commissioning.      * Ensure that all project activities comply with the relevant  regulations, standards, and codes.      * Manage all stakeholders, including clients, contractors, suppliers,  and regulatory authorities.      * Manage the project budget, including cost estimation, cost control,  and financial reporting.      * Ensure that all project activities are carried out safely and in  compliance with the relevant health and safety regulations.      * Manage all project risks and issues, including the resolution of  local issues and ROW issues.      * Ensure that all project documentation is complete and up-to-date.      * Manage all project resources, including personnel, equipment, and  materials.      * Ensure that all project activities are carried out in an  environmentally responsible manner. column2: About Us At Technip Energies, we believe in a better tomorrow, and we believe we can make tomorrow better.  With approximately 15,000 talented women and men, we are a global and leading engineering and technology company, with a clear vision to accelerate the energy transition.  Designing and delivering added value energy solutions is what we do.   About the Job Overall Systems Completion (Hand Over System) co-ordination with Sub-Contractor, PMC, and Client for Mechanical Completion. System Completion Engineering, Turnover Coordination, Construction Engineering & Completion Management. Ensure a smooth handover of Plant/Systems from Construction to Pre-Commissioning and then to Commissioning in a systemized & documented manner. Define the required steps for the Mechanical Completion of the Plant. Define the split of responsibilities between CONTRACTOR and OWNER in executing the work assignments, as the Plant or part thereof are being completed. Define the protocol forms necessary to communicate to/from OWNER the status of completeness of each part and of the whole Plant. Facilitate the recording of transfer of responsibility from CONTRACTOR to OWNER for the care, custody, and control of the plant. Preparation, review and approval of Handover Systems. Responsible for Mechanical Completion certification and handover/turnover procedures till final handover to client. Responsible for Handover System (Systems Completion) deliverables (dossiers, quality records, punch lists etc.) to client. Daily monitoring & reporting of all discipline packages and handover systems (systems completion) status. Preparation & distribution of various reports like summary completion report, detailed completion report, discipline completion report and punch list report. Regular maintaining of system completion database with latest Engineering updates through T.EN Completion Management System (Easy Plant- Completion Module, Inspection Module, Punch List Module). Coordinating with other departments / parties to complete the Handover Systems (Systems Completion) within the project milestone. Track and control all inspections/testing required for plant completion with respect to pre-fabrication, construction, and pre-commissioning for all disciplines as per the relevant ITP. Coordination of various MC walkdowns like Discipline Completion walkdown, System Completion walkdown, Plant Completion walkdown, PSSR walkdown etc. Punch list management through T.EN Punch List Data Base ( Easy Plant-Punch List Module) Overall punch list co-ordination with Sub-contractor, PMC, and Client. Manpower planning for Mechanical Completion Management team (Company & Sub-Contractor). Weekly progress review with client / consultant / contractors / vendors and management presentations. Experience in Completion Management tools About You: BE/B.Tech- Mechanical with 10 years of experience in LSTK / EPCM Projects of Oil & Gas, Refinery, Petrochemicals project completion & handover. Majorly mechanical completion. Inclusion Standards  In our continuous journey to developing and building culture of inclusion, we adhere to four Inclusion Gold Standards. And you?  We challenge our biases and embrace diversity of thought.  No one has all the knowledge and solutions, collectively we do.  We foster a caring environment where people are respected, comfortable to share and be heard.  We promote active listening for effective decision and action. Whats Next? Starting Date: Once receiving your system application, Recruiting Team will screen and match your skills, experience, and potential team fit against the role requirements.  We ask for your patience as the team completes the volume of applications with reasonable timeframe.  Check your application progress periodically via personal account from created candidate profile during your application. We invite you to get to know more about our company by visiting www.technipenergies.com and follow us on LinkedIn, Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, Youtube for company updates.

Completion of construction and tender documentation. Extensive knowledge of Frame, Trusses, and Posi-Struts detailing and manufacturing. Proven management track record in truss and frame manufacturing. Strong attention to detail and track record of quality outputs. Ability to thrive under pressure and meet tight deadlines. column2: Job Summary:  As a Civil Pipe Fitter, you will be responsible for the installation, maintenance, and repair of piping systems in the CMWSSB project.  You will work with a team of engineers, construction workers, and other professionals to ensure that piping systems are installed and maintained to the highest standards.  Your role will involve supervision of Civil works & installation of Flow meter considering pipeline safety, laying out piping systems, cutting, bending, and threading pipes, and welding or soldering pipes together.  You will also be responsible for testing piping systems for leaks and ensuring that they meet all safety and regulatory standards. You will be trained to oversee Civil works at sites.  Key Responsibilities: 1. Read and interpret blueprints, drawings, and specifications to determine the layout of piping systems. 2. Cut, bend, and thread pipes using hand and power tools. 3. Install and repair piping systems in accordance with blueprints, drawings, and specifications. 4. Weld or solder pipes together to form a complete piping system. 5. Test piping systems for leaks using pressure gauges and other testing equipment. 6. Install and maintain valves, fittings, and other components of piping systems. 7. Troubleshoot and repair piping systems as needed. 8. Ensure that piping systems meet all safety and regulatory standards. 9. Work with a team of engineers, construction workers, and other professionals to complete projects on time and within budget. Qualifications: 1. High school diploma or equivalent. 2. Completion of a pipe fitting apprenticeship program or equivalent experience. 3. Knowledge of piping materials, fittings, and installation techniques. 4. Ability to read and interpret blueprints, drawings, and specifications. 5. Proficiency in the use of hand and power tools. 6. Strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills. 7. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. 8. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. 9. Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and meet tight deadlines. 10. Knowledge of safety and regulatory standards related to piping systems.
column11: Pipeline Fitting, repair, welding, piping installation, Troubleshooting, maintenance

column2: The Government Tender and Projects Specialist will play a pivotal role in our organization, overseeing the end-to-end process of government bid submissions in India     This person will team up with various internal and external stakeholders to ensure timely, accurate, and compliant feedback on government bid opportunities       What you will be expected to do      Bid Identification and Evaluation:         Stay abreast of government bid opportunities in India relevant to our industry.     Analyze bid documents to grasp requirements, deadlines, and evaluation criteria.     Actively explore B2G business opportunities via GeM, EESL, central and state level government organizations, MNRE and its state level nodal agencies like CREDA, BREDA, etc., the International Solar Alliance, and other available.     State-level engagement with respective nodal agencies to liaison the business and project needs.         Cross-functional Teamwork:         Work closely with sales, legal, finance, and other relevant departments to gather the necessary information for bid submissions.     Foster effective communication channels to facilitate teamwork among internal and external stakeholders.         Compliance Management:         Ensure all bid submissions comply with government regulations and specifications.     Coordinate with legal and compliance teams to address any legal or regulatory requirements and also ensure the approval meets the companys policies before the final submission of the bids.         Document Preparation:         Draft, review, and edit procurement documents, ensuring clarity, accuracy, and alignment with customer needs.     Compile the necessary supporting documents, certifications, and credentials required for bid submissions.         Deadline Management:         Develop and maintain a comprehensive schedule for all bid submissions, ensuring deadlines are met.     Proactively communicate with relevant teams to gather the required information well in advance.         Quality Assurance:         Implement quality control measures to enhance the accuracy and competitiveness of procurement submissions. column2: Job Description:  We are seeking an experienced Construction Purchasing Officer to join our team. The ideal candidate will have 4-5 years of experience in purchasing and procurement within the construction industry. The Construction Purchasing Officer will be responsible for sourcing materials, equipment, and services required for construction projects, negotiating with suppliers, and ensuring timely delivery while maintaining cost-effectiveness and quality standards. Responsibilities: Develop and implement procurement strategies and policies to support construction project requirements and objectives. Identify and source suppliers for construction materials, equipment, and services, ensuring cost-effectiveness, quality, and timely delivery. Evaluate supplier proposals and negotiate terms and pricing agreements to achieve favorable terms and conditions. Collaborate with project managers, engineers, and other stakeholders to determine purchasing needs, specifications, and budgets. Prepare and issue purchase orders, contracts, and agreements, ensuring accuracy and compliance with company policies and procedures. Monitor supplier performance and resolve issues related to delivery delays, quality issues, and contract disputes. Maintain accurate records and documentation of purchasing activities, including vendor contracts, purchase orders, and pricing agreements. Coordinate with accounting and finance departments to ensure timely payment processing and resolution of invoicing discrepancies. Stay up-to-date on market trends, industry developments, and regulatory requirements related to construction materials and procurement practices.

column2: Key Requirements: Education or experience background in  construction or mechanical engineering. Proven ability to hit targets and achieve goals efficiently. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Proficiency in  English, Kannada and Hindi  (communicative level). Willingness to potentially  relocate  in the future (after 6 9 months of adaptation in Bengaluru) such as to Mumbai or Delhi. Starting date: immediately Location : Dobbaspet, Bengaluru HOW WILL YOUR CAREER PATH LOOK LIKE? It depends on you - on your skills and preferences! Whether you choose to be a  technician  OR a  junior sales manager , the direction you want to specialize in is entirely up to you, and opportunities for growth are definitely available with us!  Adaptation   Quotation Specialist/Junior Technician Specialist  (1.-3. months)  -  the starting position for the first 1-3 months, where you will learn everything from the basics. You will be responsible for providing technical support to the sales team (from processing price quotes to preparing technical and design solutions). You will get to know our production and benefit from our know-how, which we are happy to share with you.  Grow with us as a Technician! Technician ( 3.-6. months) - you will take responsibility for providing overall technical support to the implementation team. You will work daily in AutoCAD and Revit for designing technical solutions, communicate under the LIKO-S brand with our suppliers and customers.  Senior Technician  (7.-9. months) - you will further specialize in the technical field as a senior technician, taking on additional responsibilities associated with this role. The salary for this position ranges from 80,000 to 90,000 Rupees per month.  Grow with us as a Sales Professional!   Junior Sales Manager  (3.-6. months) - your main task will be shadowing the senior business manager in the sales field of our main segment: convertible, mobile, and interactive partitions. You will be in contact with architects, investors, and general construction contractors, engaging in cold calls and scheduling meetings, preparing contracts, managing and processing price quotes and calculations.  Area Sales Manager  (7.-9. months) - you will advance to the role of a senior and independent sales professional, someone who is goal-oriented and enjoys establishing and maintaining relationships with new customers.  We can offer: An important position in which you can develop your horizon within a vibrant international production organization where you have the  opportunity for personal development. Motivational salary  with participation in the profit of our branch and yearly bonus. Great opportunity to work for a strong family business based in Europe, in the Czech Republic, The opportunity for future  career growth  in either a technical or sales direction, depending on your preferences and how you profile yourself. Work with our collegues at our European headquarters, travel or relocate directly within India. How will the selection process take place?   Send us your  CV , preferably with a short introduction about yourself and your experience. Within 3-5 days, our HR will get in touch with you, and you will arrange a brief introductory  online interview  to clarify mutual expectations and get to know each other better. We will meet for an online interview, where we will guide you through the company and we will check your knowledge on a  technical test. Meet us in personal  interview  at our branch so you can see how our production looks like. If everything goes according to our and your expectations, we will send you a  job offer  right away. If you are enthusiastic about technical challenges, possess a keen eye for construction details, and thrive in a dynamic work environment, we encourage you to apply to barbora.nemcova@liko-s.cz Join us at LIKO-S and became part of our innovative LIKO-S team!

column2: We are currently seeking a qualified Project Manager, Distribution Design Utility Services      This position will be responsible for the design and project management of electrical utility projects for our overseas clients      This Project Manager will closely work with clients, external and internal stakeholders, as well as senior management to manage the day-to-day project operations and budgets related to the clients program      The candidate will coordinate with other Project Coordinators and Design staff to advance projects and solve design challenges            Responsibilities        Lead the overhead and underground electrical distribution projects by creating detailed scopes and estimates, performing calculations, developing detailed design drawings following applicable utility standards.          Develop unique design solutions to fit our client s needs with a sound understanding of overall goals and objectives.          Lead, mentor and coach junior designers and project team members to ensure the best and most efficient designs are created for the client.          Support professional engineers with technical studies and/or calculations, software analysis, drafting and specifications, and preparation of cost estimates.          Prepare and/or review construction packages, include all required drawings, work instructions, planning documentation, and regulatory approvals.          Help coordinate construction projects liaise, consult, and communicate with key project stakeholders.          Prepare concept designs to client and other required standards utilizing software and existing design and construction guidelines.          Financial and budgetary accountability for the assigned projects and supporting team members. Work to develop, communicate and manage resource budgets and completion timeframes.          Demonstrated ability to use specialized computer programs, including CAD and GIS systems, project management software, financial and billing software.          Attend site meetings with clients or third parties as and when required.          Adhere to strict project budgets and client deliverable dates.          Other activities as may be required from time to time based on business needs.        Requirements        Graduate / Post graduate degree in Electrical Engineering with 10-12 years of relevant work experience, of which at least 3-5 years managing projects as Project Manager/Lead,    preferably with an electrical utility / distribution company.          Proficiency in the operation of GIS based applications or drafting tool, such as, AutoCAD would be an advantage.          Must be able to interpret engineers notes and convert into detailed design drawings accurately and in a timely manner.          Understanding of 22.04, USF, CSA, IHSA and other related standards and regulations          Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills.          Excellent written and oral communication skills.          The ability to deal with multiple projects and conflicting deadlines and get along with the team.          Strong knowledge / expertise in structural detailing / drawing of reinforced concrete structures and structural steel elements.          Working knowledge of concrete and steel structural design principles.          Familiar with industry codes, engineering practices, standards, and construction methods.          Great interpersonal skills with the ability to develop business relationships.          Relevant trade and project management experience considered as an added advantage.        Preferred Skills        Experience with Overhead and Underground Distribution Systems working with an Electrical Distribution company.          Working knowledge of SPIDA Calc, Quick pole, O Calc, or other pole line related analysis.

column2: CAI is seeking motivated Building Commissioning/Data Centre Electrical Lead professionals to support Data Centre projects across the APAC Region. These are full-time opportunities with competitive compensation and benefits which include: up to 15% retirement contribution, medical insurance for employee and eligible dependents, dental insurance, life and disability insurance, maternity coverage for employee or spouse and financial support for both internal and external professional education. CAI is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.         As consultants to the entire industry, our employee owners are driven by the challenge and constant diversity of assignments, while having the stability of a company that has never had a lay off. On any given day we could be responsible for a myriad of things involved in starting a facility, equipment startup and test script writing and execution, SATs, walk downs, FWT / FATs, burn in tests and development of summary reports at the client site.          Lead Electrical Engineers will work as part of the CAI Data Centre / Building Commissioning team and be responsible for the commissioning of mission critical electrical equipment, safe electrical work practices, facility turnover, and issue resolution. Data Centre/ Building Commissioning professionals develop and execute the commissioning tests to demonstrate to the customer that vendor equipment is correctly installed and set to work, support enhanced design reviews, and consult on submission of LEED qualification packages.             Responsibilities:                               Development of electrical equipment and system test scripts         Attend and be an active participant of customer equipment FWT/FAT         Vendor coordination and management         Perform equipment inspection to ensure build adherence to vendor submittal         Provide test and documentation that equipment is delivered, installed, and tested correctly and set to function properly for customer         Support and perform design specification review, manufacturer submittals, one line drawing sets, and project schedule documentation         QA/QC of electrical equipment installation\startup         Assign test commissioning tasks to electrical commissioning team         Execute test scripts to confirm equipment and system operation to design specification         Ensure safe work practices are followed by all on commissioning team and customer site         Engage with customers to ensure positive experience, goals achievement, and schedule adherence         Provide daily reports for electrical commissioning team status         Conduct facility walk downs, turnover, and punch list reviews         General understanding of LEED specifications and requirements         Look for new opportunities for CAI to provide service and value to customer         Business development in a part time capacity.         Duties may be increased as experience and skill allow                     Qualifications     :                   Bachelor s degree in electrical or equivalent           Minimum of 12 years Building or Data Center Commissioning experience       .         Knowledge of OSHA and NFPA 70E safety requirements.         Good written and spoken communication skills.         Ability to read and interpret electrical schematics and specifications.         Knowledge of Data Center design concepts.         Knowledge and commissioning experience with Electrical Distribution Switchgear, Substations, Uninterruptable Power Sources (UPS), Automatic Transfer Switches (ATS), Batteries, Emergency Diesel Generators & Load Banks.         Knowledge of power quality analysis.          Strong experience with Word, Excel and PowerPoint.          Ability to effectively write electrical commissioning scripts, daily reports, and final commissioning reports.         Experience in 1 or more of the following:          o Data Centre construction / commissioning         o Electrical switching operations         o Equipment inspections         o Low and/or medium voltage equipment commissioning         o LEED commissioning         o Factory Witness Test / Factory Acceptance Test attendances         o Leading electrical commissioning processes         o Equipment/ facility handover         Data Center facilities operations experience is desired, but not essentail               ?         Other Requirements:                   Excellent oral and written English is required         Extensive travel may be required (75%)         Candidates must have a Passport or the ability to immediately get a Passport.         Work under construction site conditions
column11: Switchgear, Test scripts, Script writing, qaqc, SAT, Issue resolution, construction site, Vendor, Quality analysis, Electricals

column2: 7-10 years in Oil and Gas with a major contractor or consultant predominantly performing detail design     Bachelor s Degree in Engineering (Master s degree is preferred)     Strong working knowledge of many design techniques and analysis methods, and detailed knowledge of the content and application of standards codes and guidelines as applicable     Preferably Registered Professional Engineer or member of professional engineering society as applicable      Seasoned knowledge of engineering standards and specifications     Good knowledge of engineering software     Able to work independently     Good working knowledge of English, both oral and written     HSE, TQM and cost-conscious     Good organizer, motivator, and supervisor     Keen on improving the effectiveness of the work     Show flexibility and ensure proper hand-over with regards to:     The reassignment to other departments/construction sites/fabrication yards     The replacement of colleagues during illness and holidays     The provision of assistance to other colleagues with heavy workloads (also other projects) when possible/desirable     The managing/learning of current working methods and software applications     The reassignment to other McDermott offices             Key Tasks and Responsibilities:         Perform the engineering for onshore and offshore pipeline systems; this role requires thorough knowledge of design codes and shall be hands-on with the software used in the pipeline discipline     Perform conceptual, FEED, Studies, and detailed analyses and design as per design basis, project specifications, design codes, and standards; as such, they must have in-depth expertise in pipeline engineering as well as broad knowledge of the pipeline engineering discipline within the engineering function; they shall be able to apply knowledge and skills to a wide range of standard and non-standard situations     Prepare clear and accurate detailed design calculations and analyses including design reports and procedures; they shall have good time management capabilities to meet agreed deadlines and budgets and develop plans for short-term work activities in their own area     Clearly communicate and explain complex issues and work to establish understanding     Be fully familiar with the project scope of work, specifications, schedule, and all inter-discipline requirements; including identifying concerns as early as practicable and taking appropriate initiatives to address the issues     Identify changes to scope and promptly raise change notifications, including providing any necessary supporting documentation and estimates Provide similar support for Variation Orders     Assist in the preparation of estimates for bid proposals, including technical query reviews, execution statements, and manhour estimates     Raise technical queries to obtain missing information, clarify work scope, and maintain preferred McDermott procedures, specifications, standards, practices, and operational requirements     Prepare Discipline engineering design basis, philosophies, and technical specifications, as required     Participate in finalizing deliverables lists and deliverables, ensuring compliance with specifications and functional integrity     Attend project review meetings, vendor meetings, engineering meetings, and offshore site surveys, as required     Provide technical direction and review of Designers producing products related to Pipeline Engineering     Prepare and review design reports and procedures     Assist in providing necessary design inputs to other disciplines to enable them to proceed with their deliverables     Assist procurement personnel in procuring Discipline equipment, materials, and services; ensuring that work produced complies with Customer objectives and procedures; Procurement assistance includes preparing and reviewing requisitions, evaluating technical quotations, preparing queries, compiling bid tabulations and recommendations, preparing purchase requisitions, and coordinating with Procurement to expedite vendor documents, as directed by Discipline Lead Engineer     Assist in updating weight report based on receipt of vendor information     Review vendor and subcontractor submittals, checking for compliance with project specifications and providing comments as necessary     Perform design verification through single-discipline check/ inter-discipline check (IDC)     Provide technical support to all fabrication queries, including identifying defect/rectification requirements     Keep the Lead Engineer apprised of all activities and concerns, technical, budgetary and manpower related     Assist in providing inputs for actual, planning, and forecasting progress reports including associated productivity     Check final subcontractor and vendor data manuals to ensure that all requested data has been received and approved     Participate in internal, Customer, and third-party technical audits on engineering deliverables and vendor documents     Assist Lead Engineer with responses to Customer and other agencies (such as certifying authorities, auditors, third parties, etc.) on their review and approval     Capture lessons learned and enter into MDRs Lessons Learned system     Act as a resource for colleagues with less experience     Guide less experienced engineers on MDR and Discipline procedures, standards, worksheets, design calculations, software, requisitions, technical bid evaluations, technical queries, etc.     Be aware of costs related to own work and of the discipline     Prepare/ review the following for pipelines and their components:      Material specifications and datasheets     Fabrication specifications     Installation specifications     Pipeline design and installation analyses     Material takeoffs     Pipeline reports and installation manuals         Perform/review the following designs, analyses, and evaluations for pipelines and their components:       Wall thickness designs     On-bottom stability analyses     Pipeline cathodic protection designs     Free-span analyses     Pipeline expansion and rigid riser stress analyses using finite element analysis (FEA) tools     Route selection designs     Bottom roughness evaluations     Crossing support designs     Dropped object protection structure designs     Clamp designs     Subsea structure designs     Shore approach designs     Onshore pipeline designs     Pipeline local and global buckling mitigation designs     Pipeline seismic analyses     Installation analyses
column11: Fabrication, Cathodic protection, TQM, Engineering Design, Finite element analysis, HSE, Vendor, Forecasting, Operations, Technical support

column2: About Us At Technip Energies, we believe in a better tomorrow, and we believe we can make tomorrow better.  With approximately 15,000 talented women and men, we are a global and leading engineering and technology company, with a clear vision to accelerate the energy transition.  Designing and delivering added value energy solutions is what we do.   About the Job Overall Systems Completion (Hand Over System) co-ordination with Sub-Contractor, PMC, and Client for Mechanical Completion. System Completion Engineering, Turnover Coordination, Construction Engineering & Completion Management. Ensure a smooth handover of Plant/Systems from Construction to Pre-Commissioning and then to Commissioning in a systemized & documented manner. Define the required steps for the Mechanical Completion of the Plant. Define the split of responsibilities between CONTRACTOR and OWNER in executing the work assignments, as the Plant or part thereof are being completed. Define the protocol forms necessary to communicate to/from OWNER the status of completeness of each part and of the whole Plant. Facilitate the recording of transfer of responsibility from CONTRACTOR to OWNER for the care, custody, and control of the plant. Preparation, review and approval of Handover Systems. Responsible for Mechanical Completion certification and handover/turnover procedures till final handover to client. Responsible for Handover System (Systems Completion) deliverables (dossiers, quality records, punch lists etc.) to client. Daily monitoring & reporting of all discipline packages and handover systems (systems completion) status. Preparation & distribution of various reports like summary completion report, detailed completion report, discipline completion report and punch list report. Regular maintaining of system completion database with latest Engineering updates through T.EN Completion Management System (Easy Plant- Completion Module, Inspection Module, Punch List Module). Coordinating with other departments / parties to complete the Handover Systems (Systems Completion) within the project milestone. Track and control all inspections/testing required for plant completion with respect to pre-fabrication, construction, and pre-commissioning for all disciplines as per the relevant ITP. column2: This role is part of Arcadis Global Excellence Centre (GEC) and will join our 3,000+ talented individuals working in India, Romania, and Philippines, in partnership with Arcadis offices globally. The GEC brings key capabilities and capacity to support our clients seamlessly around the world. For those in GEC there are options to be dedicated to one country; developing deep knowledge and strong relationships, as we'll as opportunities to be part of teams working truly globally as a centre of excellence, offering diversity and variety. Arcadians are by nature, globally minded and culturally aware, and Arcadis strongly believes in flexibility which enables change over time as your career progresses. The GEC model is we'll embedded in Arcadis, and the strong relationships that exist between our global offices are truly unique.          ?       Role Accountabilities:       ?     As a Electrical Engineer in our Global Excellence Centres (GEC), you will play a major role and will be part of Rail System Group under Rail which is one of Global Business Areas (GBA). You will be reporting to Principal Engineer and Senior Engineer. You will also collaborate with the lead regions and stakeholders on a regular basis. You will manage the delivery of the projects to meet time, quality, budgetary and health and safety targets       Extensive knowledge and understanding the requirement of LU, network rail, UK Building regulation and BS 7671 regulation.     Working Knowledge in AUTOCAD, REVIT or AECOsim and NAVISWORKS will be an added advantage.     Proficient in using the following engineering software: Amtech, Furse Strike and lighting calculations like Dialux, Dialux Evo and Relux and other software s like Bluebeam.     Liaise with other disciplines within the MEP Project Team, other discipline like architects and civil team for coordination MEP works and ensure all requirements are understood.         Nice to Have:         Proficient in the application of international design standards: UK (most preferred), Europe, and Middle East.     Proficient in the following Electrical engineering design fundamentals: Lighting, power distribution, Earthing and Lightning Protection, containment system and lighting control system.         Qualifications & Experience:         Graduate of Bachelor of Science/Engineering in Electrical Discipline from recognized University

column2: Supernova Engineers Ltd is looking for Estimation Engineer to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      The Estimation Engineer is responsible for analyzing project requirements, preparing cost estimates, and providing accurate and competitive bids for construction or engineering projects      They will work closely with project managers, engineers, and procurement teams to gather necessary information and develop comprehensive cost estimates      The Estimation Engineer plays a crucial role in ensuring the accuracy and profitability of project bids        Key Responsibilities:        Review project plans, specifications, and contract documents to understand project requirements and scope      Collaborate with project managers, engineers, and other stakeholders to gather necessary information for cost estimation      Analyze project drawings, technical specifications, and bills of quantities to determine the quantities and costs of materials, labor, and equipment required      Conduct site visits and assessments to gather information and assess project conditions that may impact cost estimates      Prepare accurate cost estimates, including material take-offs, labor costs, equipment costs, and indirect costs      Research and source material and equipment prices from suppliers and subcontractors to ensure accurate pricing in estimates      Evaluate project risks and contingencies and incorporate them into cost estimates      Prepare detailed cost breakdowns, including cost summaries, itemized lists, and supporting documentation      Participate in bid review meetings to present cost estimates, answer questions, and provide clarifications to stakeholders      Collaborate with procurement teams to assist in sourcing and evaluating suppliers and subcontractors for cost competitiveness      Qualifications and Skills:Bachelor's degree in engineering, construction management, or a related field      Strong knowledge of construction methods, materials, and processes      Proficiency in reading and interpreting project drawings, specifications, and contract documents      Experience with cost estimation software and tools      Strong analytical and mathematical skills, with attention to detail      Excellent organizational and time management skills to handle multiple projects and meet deadlines      Good communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate effectively with project teams and stakeholders      Knowledge of local construction codes, regulations, and industry standards      Ability to work independently and make sound decisions based on project requirements and constraints

column2: A solar civil construction engineer plays a crucial role in the development of solar energy projects, ensuring that the construction phase meets safety standards, environmental regulations, and project requirements. Here's a breakdown of the job description: Role & Responsibilities Collaborate with project managers and engineers to plan and execute solar energy projects, ensuring compliance with specifications and regulations. Review technical documents and oversee on-site construction activities to ensure quality and safety standards are met. Enforce safety protocols and environmental regulations, while maintaining accurate documentation of construction progress and compliance. Identify and resolve construction-related issues promptly, while coordinating with stakeholders to minimize delays and cost overruns. Qualifications Qualifications for this job may include: Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering, Construction Management, Electrical Engineering, or related field (preferred). Previous experience in solar energy construction or related field. Proficiency in project management software and Microsoft Office Suite. Strong communication, leadership, and problem-solving skills. Knowledge of environmental and safety regulations related to construction projects. Overall, a solar civil construction engineer plays a vital role in the successful implementation of solar energy projects, ensuring that construction activities are completed safely, on time, and within budget while meeting quality and regulatory standards.

Technical Expertise:          Stay updated with the latest advancements, technologies, and trends in MEP systems design and implementation. column2: Job Description:  BIM (Building Information Modeling) controller  A BIM controller is responsible for managing and coordinating the digital design process of a construction project using BIM software and tools. A BIM controller works closely with the project team, including architects, engineers, contractors, and clients, to monitor that the BIM model is accurate, consistent, and compliant with the project requirements and standards. A BIM controller also monitors the quality and progress of the BIM deliverables and provides feedback and guidance to the project team. 1. Developing and implementing the BIM execution plan and BIM standards for the project 2. Creating and maintaining the BIM models and data sets throughout the project lifecycle 3. Performing clash detection and resolution, design validation, and model coordination using BIM software and tools 4. Managing and updating the BIM information and documentation, such as drawings, schedules, specifications, and reports 5. Facilitating the collaboration and communication among the project team and stakeholders using BIM platforms and systems 6. Providing technical support and training to the project team and subcontractors on BIM software and tools 7. Identifying and resolving any issues or challenges related to the BIM process and deliverables 8. Evaluating and improving the BIM performance and quality of the project   Fiza Shaikh | Assistant Manager CBRE South Asia Pvt.
